text.topicspec: Order of business
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: Thank you President.

text.topicspec: Order of business
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: Well, some colleagues took the initiative of putting in the agenda an urgency resolution on Brazil's refusal to extradite Cesare Battisti to Italy.

text.topicspec: Order of business
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: I do understand their motives, but as I shall demonstrate, this is not a present human rights case.

text.topicspec: Order of business
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: It is not an urgent case and it is not even a 'breach of the Rule of Law' case.

text.topicspec: Order of business
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: Furthermore, it comes at a terrible moment when Brazil is facing the worst natural disaster in its history.

text.topicspec: Order of business
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: Cesare Battisti is in prison.

text.topicspec: Order of business
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: He is waiting for a decision of the Brazil Supreme Court and the Supreme Court is in the holidays of the southern hemisphere.

text.topicspec: Order of business
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: There is no reason to believe that there won't be an independent decision.

text.topicspec: Order of business
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: I expressed my solidarity with the families of the victims in this case and, rest assured, I have no sympathy towards political violence either from the right or the left, but we should use the urgencies to debate Southern Sudan, the case of Buchtar Tabuni in In- in Indonesia, or the Palestinian man shot dead in his bed.

text.topicspec: Order of business
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: Will the Parliament grant President Dilma Rousseff, on the very first occasion after her groundbaking groundbreaking election and for no sound formal reason, the kind of debate that we usually reserve for people like Mugabe?

text.topicspec: Order of business
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: So, I ask you to remove Brazil from the agenda of the urgencies.

text.topicspec: Order of business
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Thank you very much Mr President.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Mr President, honourable members, the recent popular uprising in Tunisia is unprecedented in the modern history of the country.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: On the 17 December, a young university graduate set himself on fire out of sheer desperation after police seized the fruits and vegetables that he was selling for a living.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Less than a month later, nationwide protests have brought about the definitive departure of President Ben Ali.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: The European Union has condemned the violence of the repression during the last days of the regime.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: As I speak, the security situation remains precarious.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Looting and violence are still reported.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Tunisia remains in a very delicate phase, although first news about formation of national unity government are just coming in.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Despite some uncertainty, the message of the Tunisian people is loud and clear:

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Tunisia wants to be a stable democracy in full respect of fundamental rights and freedoms.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: It wants free and fair, inclusive elections.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: They want to write a new page in their history and we want to support them in this endeavour.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: The respect of the Constitution and the steps taken, as we speak, to bring together a national solidarity government, go in the right direction.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Of course, this is only a start.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: The European Union has never ceased to remind Tunisia of its international obligations in the field of human rights and fundamental freedoms.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Ever since the start of my term, ever since my hearing before this House, in fact, I have repeated that enhanced status clearly meant enhanced commitments in all areas of our relationship, including fundamental freedoms and human rights.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: I have stressed in all meetings with the Tunisian authorities, on behalf of the European Commission, that they had to deliver on their democratic and human rights commitments.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: At the very first session of negotiations on the action plan for status avancé, I insisted personally, in unprecedented and the clearest way, that any use of new Article 61 bis of the Penal Code would be seen by us as incompatible with status avancé and with our shared values.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: And, by the way, if there were still sceptics on both sides who thought that these values were only shared in theory, they should listen again and again to the voice of the Tunisian streets over the last days and weeks.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: What was this if not a solemn demand for democracy and for more economic justice?

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: As Catherine Ashton and I stated this morning, the European Union stands ready to support a truly inclusive electoral process with appropriate guarantees.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: We hope its modalities can be announced as soon as... possible, once the national unity government has been shaped and starts its work.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: We are ready to provide immediate assistance to prepare and organise the electoral process, as well as lasting support to a genuine democratic transition.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: We are also working on a broader package to assist, as soon as the situation stabilises, with, among others, economic development, close attention to the social problems faced by Tunisia's youth, or consolidating the rule of law and the judiciary.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: And we will, of course, continue consulting closed with this House and with our Member States on this process.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Mr President, honourable members, the European Neighbourhood Policy is based on essential values shared by the European Union and its partners: democracy, human rights and open market economy, in order to build together a shared area of democracy, stability and prosperity.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: European Commission has always stressed that these values were an essential component of our neighbourhood policy, both towards our southern and our eastern neighbours.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: With its strong middle class, high level of education, closeness to Europe and overall moderation, Tunisia is well placed to take the leap towards democracy that people have now asked for with such force and courage, and I think everybody should agree that the European Union also has a strong interest in a democratic, prosperous and stable Tunisia.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: We have a long-standing and robust relationship with Tunisia, intense links among our peoples and our business communities.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: It is a high representative Vice-President and mine ambition that we can now strengthen our bilateral relations based on new commitments by our partners on governance, respect of the rule, of law and fundamental freedoms, as well as economic and social reforms.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: We will do our utmost to help the Tunisian people to turn its aspiration into reality.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Thank you very much.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: Excuse me.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: Thank you President, Commissioner Füle, colleagues, I would like to congratulate the Tunisian people for their bravery, courage and persistence to speak up for opportunities and freedom, and I hope all can refrain from using violence and that there will be free and fair elections soon.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: Citizens spoke out against a repressive regime which used bullets and killed its youth.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: Only weak governments go to such lengths to go and preserve their artificially obtained corrupt power and wealth.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: Regimes derive their legitimacy from providing for the well-being of their citizens, not by closing universities and access to information and free communications.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: In access to information, the opposition used the Internet, and the Internet is becoming more and more important for peaceful opposition across the world.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: I learned about the uprising of the citizens' movement in Tunisia throughout the Internet and eyewitness accounts that were posted there and it took about a month of the struggle before mainstream media and political leadership woke up to the realities of the street.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: In the same week, last week, the French Minister for Foreign Affairs offered help to the Tunisian government in the form of riot police and assistance in the police.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: What is the Commission's response to this offer and where was the help for citizens in support of their rights?

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: The confrontation between the Tunisian government and its people took place as much on the streets as it did on the virtual highways, the Internet.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: The Tunisian government has been known, or was known, as being among the most advanced in the use of filtering and censoring software, and over the past month, it spared no efforts to repress people through these technologies.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: Repressive regimes across the world continue to use technologies to silence the free word.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: Today, it's Martin Luther King Day and Martin Luther King said:

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: "A time comes when silence becomes betrayal".

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: Commissioner Füle, that time has long bec- beca- ehm arrived.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: The US, the United States have lost significantly in their credibility in their fight in leadership for Internet freedom.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: The EU has a struggle still coming up, about which we will speak tonight with the upcoming Hungarian laws.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: But the young, freedom-loving generation across the world is looking towards the symbolic example that Tunisia gave and is looking towards the EU for support, and there's no reason why we should not lead in defending people's freedoms, including on the Internet.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Schaake Marietje
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: President, the upheaval in Tunisia is undoubtedly a reflection of people's frustration at the country's political and relative economic stagnation.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: The flagrant corruption and wealth of the ruling family elite contrasted sharply with the high levels of poverty and unemployment amongst ordinary people.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: Former President Ben Ali paid the... supreme price for failing to meet the expectations and aspirations of his people, but I do not agree with some assessments, particularly in the Green Group, that his government was one of the most repressive in the Arab world.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: Tunisia has been an example, in some ways, of a modern, secular and progressive Arab country.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: E.g., polygamy was banned, veils were banned, foreign direct in- ehm investment was encouraged, tourism was encouraged.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: Tunisia has managed to resist the efforts of violent Jihadis to undermine the integrity of its secular society.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: It's therefore essential that Tunisia's political leaders, the new leaders that will now emerge, protect that legacy, because Salafist extremists will undoubtedly try to take advantage of the chaos and turmoil that that will advance their dangerous agenda, which obviously also threatens European ehm political and foreign policy objectives.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: Tunisia's new political leadership also needs to understand that poor governance and gross inequality offer a fertile breeding ground for violent radicalism.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: I'm encouraged that the interim leadership has promised substantial reforms because embarking on such a path will greatly strengthen Tunisia's relationship with the European Union.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: In the meantime, my group calls for maximum restraint by the security forces and for the arrest and trial of the ancien regime's presidential guard leadership responsible for the recent shooting, in the last few days, of innocent bystanders, in a futile attempt to de- destabilise the country.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: And I congratulate the professionalism of the army in protecting the Republic's institutions.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: We in the EU must give the new Tunisian government of unity every assistance and also afford every assistance to EU citizens, including British citizens, who are stranded there, having been there on a holiday.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: Thank you Mr President.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: Mr Buzek, you made some remarks at the beginning of the debate about free and fair elections and good representative government and you asked us support asked us to support the people of Tunisia.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: No democrat could disagree.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: People will tolerate a lot from incompetent, corrupt and incompetent governments, but push them too far and they will rebel.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: It's a doctrine of internal security services that any population is only 3 days away from riots and civil in- unrest when the food supplies run out.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: Are there any parallels to be drawn between what's happening in Tunisia and the European Union?

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: Ehm the EU gives undemocratic and incompetent government.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: It has a political class that is increasingly detached from the wishes of its people.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: There is high youth unemployment in many countries in Europe ehm as a direct result of EU policies.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: There are already riots and civil unrest in Greece due to its purely ideological commitment to the European single currency.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: Countries like Spain, Portugal and Ireland may soon follow Greece as their economies become untenable in the straitjacket of the euro.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: Don't think that it cannot happen in European countries.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: When governments become the enemies of their own people, then the peoples will eventually rebel.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: I agree with what you said in your introduction Mr President, but let's see those principles applied in Europe as well as in other countries of the world.

text.topicspec: Statement by the President of the European Parliament on the situation in Tunisia
speaker.name: Batten Gerard
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Thank you Mr President and ehm thank you colleagues.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: It's a good way to start the New Year with this debate and tomorrow's vote on the deal concluded under the Belgian Presidency on this important report on construction products.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: I'd like to start by thanking all colleagues who made this possible for their hard work, their thoughtfulness and commitment to making this proposal a reality.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: I would also like to put on record my thanks to the IMCO Secretariat and to the Belgian Presidency, in particular, to Mr Vertessen and Mr Haerynck for all their dedicated work.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: As I said in my report paraphrasing the poet Robert Frost:

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: "Good neighbours have good fences" question mark.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: It's important that we maintain the momentum to complete the single market and to break down barriers to trade.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: As Mario Monti said in his report on the Single mar- Market acknowledges that Europe is still in a phase of 'market construction' which requires breaking down the barriers to cross border activity, cutting dead wood of national administrations and technical barriers and overcoming corporate resistance.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: With this proposal we have attempted to make the single market work more effectively, we've attempted to have clearer and more transparent systems in place so that products placed in the market are of the highest standards and that the construction industry has a fairer marketplace to trade within.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Currently, the construction industry faces the economic challenges caused by the global financial meltdown of 2008 and exasperated by the slow economic recovery we face across the European Union.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: We should never forget what an important sector the construction industry is: 12 million EU citizens are directly employed and 26 million EU citizens are dependent on the sector.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: That is 38 million people reliant on the sector.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: For economic growth, construction is essential for jobs and employment.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: It is also one of the most dangerous sectors to work within.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Taking Germany, whose safety record is second to none, 1 construction worker in 5,000 will suffer a fatal accident during their lifetime.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: The health and safety of those who work at the coalface of construction requires to always be remembered and it's important to have acknowledgement of this in the report.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: It was with this in mind that we successfully managed on both sides to come to some agreement on the issue of labelling hazardous substances, so that it was in line with REACH but also helps those who work with products which, in the past, have led to chronic conditions and death: conditions such as asbestos-related mesotheliomia and, to an extent, those who get chronic obstructive pulmonary disease in their working conditions and inhaling dust.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: The proper labelling of hazardous substances can help those with l- these lung conditions and illustrates how interlinked our work here is.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: I'm proud of the fact that this report was cond- was was conducted and concluded under the European Year of the Lung.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Lung health is so often neglected and I was delighted that in this Parliament, we recognised its importance.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: I would also like to briefly comment on SMEs.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: In Parliament, we are urged to 'think small first' and this should carry throughout our work.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: This is why we've managed to create a second stream for smaller corporations to place their products in the internal market and the system should make it cheaper and more practical for SMEs to reach a larger marketplace which can only increase their trading potential.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: On the separate issue over transparency and who serves on and how technical bodies work, I think that we've moved the bodies who approve products further than we'd originally foreseen.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: The transparency over processes and the approval of products can only help break down the walls and barriers which exist in the European Union today.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: This should help companies in the EU and, in particular, the special conditions set for micro-enterprises are also helpful at these tough economic conditions.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: In the European Union, we should always strive for better regulations.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Along with my shadow rapporteurs, I've modified the sections of the report which are no longer relevant or are so unclear that no one is able to follow them or ensure their application.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: For an industry such as the construction sector, it's imperative that the rules are clear and I look forward to seeing the difference these particular changes will make.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: The scale is huge and the challenges many, but today, these new rules which will come into force through Member States in the next 24 months will help the construction sector as we attempt to create economic growth and, through this, jobs.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Thank you Mr President.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: McClarkin Emma
s.text: Ehm thank you madam Chairman and thank you to Mrs Stihler for her hard work.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: McClarkin Emma
s.text: It has been a very long road.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: McClarkin Emma
s.text: In Europe today, the construction sector employs directly 12 million EU citizens.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: McClarkin Emma
s.text: In addition, approximately 92 percent of the manufacturers of construction materials are small and medium-sized enterprises: this amounts over 65,000 individual businesses.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: McClarkin Emma
s.text: Clearly, the construction sector is vital for the European economy, and we have a responsibility to the industry to help support it, especially after the economic crisis.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: McClarkin Emma
s.text: There are many aspects of this report which produced something of a stalemate between many of us, such as the nature of EU legislation.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: McClarkin Emma
s.text: It is not perfect, it is a compromise.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: McClarkin Emma
s.text: Key issues included the declaration of performance or CE marking, where a successful agreement was made to ensure micro-enterprises do not face the same burdens as larger companies.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: McClarkin Emma
s.text: And on tackling and identifying hazardous substances in construction products, we managed to broker a compromise ensuring no conflict with existing REACH regulations .

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: McClarkin Emma
s.text: I hope that this second-reading agreement will have real results and encourage the free movement of construction products, improve standards across the EU, and promote the recycling of construction products in future whilst, most importantly, not increasing bureaucratic burdens on businesses or confusing consumers.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Harbour Malcolm
s.text: Oh thank you very much indeed madam President, ehm and as Chairman of the Committee, ehm I want to associate myself very much with many of the remarks: in fact, I think of all the remarks people have made about the work that Catherine Stihler has done and I think ehm taking over a complex dossier for a second reading ehm and coming into our Committee to do that I think has been a tough task that she's done extremely well.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Harbour Malcolm
s.text: And I would remark madam President that I think it shows the importance of the second-reading procedure in this House, ehm because we have ma- we have been able to make significant improvements to the text that we received ehm the common position that we received ehm from the Council.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Harbour Malcolm
s.text: Ehm as Mrs Rühle in particular pointed out, we had some disagreements with them.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Harbour Malcolm
s.text: We do have a letter from the Hungarian Presidency about that which will be published with the Minutes ehm on some of the detailed issues.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Harbour Malcolm
s.text: Now I just want to ehm make two concluding remarks ehm in endorsing this agreement.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Harbour Malcolm
s.text: The first one is to say to you, ehm Commissioner, ehm first of all in thanking you for ehm your work with us, ehm that we need to work very closely with you on the implementation of this proposal.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Harbour Malcolm
s.text: As you pointed out, there are important aspects of comitology here and my Committee is absolutely ehm behind the need to follow up these these ehm pro- proposals very seriously.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Harbour Malcolm
s.text: And secondly, I think that this is an absolutely crucial sector and we do need to keep it, as many of co- colleagues said, under review, to make sure that there are no, in effect, no market barriers put in place that are going to stop it contributing vitally to the European economy.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Thank you ehm madam President and thank you to all colleagues who have taken the time ehm to speak ehm this afternoon and this evening.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Ehm I think ehm Mr the Commissioner ehm Mr Tajani's ehm comments about partnership working, about the road map, the issue of Euroco- codes, which Mrs Rühle also mentioned and Mr I think Schwab ehm indicated, is important and that we take forward ehm the good cooperation that we've had.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: It is a compromise that we've reached and there are some things colleagues may have liked in this compromise that we didn't manage to get in, but Parliament managed to secure 75 percent of the amendments that we thought were important within this text, and that's no mean feat.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: There's something that struck me through this debate.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: The construction sector is so vitally important to our economies for future growth, for jobs, that I would like to ask ehm the President ehm mis- vi- Vice-President whether we can make sure there's an annual debate on the construction sector in this House, to also take forward that cooperation that the Commission Commissioner has offered to us and to make sure that we always place the importance on the construction sector that this House should do, which is the fact that so many 38 million people rely on the construction sector for their jobs.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: So, thank you, madam President, thank you, Commissioner, and I look forward to the... weeks, months, years ahead, because the construction ehm debate will continue in the Internal Market Committee and I is one who'll certainly be following it.

text.topicspec: Harmonised conditions for the marketing of construction products
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: Honourable members, madam President.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: As you are well aware, the New Year started with a serious incident of dioxin contamination of animal feed in Germany.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: The Commission services have been monitoring developments closely and in full cooperation with the competent German authorities.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: I have already started reflecting on possible measures which will ensure that our high-level food and feed safety system will become even more efficient.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: But let me start with the facts of the incident first: the incident came to light when a compound feed manufacturer notified the German competent authorities on 22nd December 2010 after having received the analytical result from a laboratory that a sample was found to be non-compliant with EU legislation after self-controlled test.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: Between middle of November and middle of December of last year, a biodiesel manufacturer delivered 7 consignments of fatty acids intended for technical purposes to a feed fat manufacturer who also produces fats for technical use.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: This latter company was, at the same time, a registered feed fat manufacturer;

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: apparently, blending of feed grade fat and technical fat took place. 4 of these consignments delivered in the second half of November were later found to be contaminated with dioxins.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: The other 3 delivered to feed mills in the first half of December 2010 were not contaminated.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: However, until this was verified and for purely precautionary reasons, all consignments were regarded and treated as potentially contaminated.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: A total of almost 2,300 tonnes of potentially contaminated feed fat was delivered to 25 feed manufacturers in Germany.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: No deliveries of feed fat were made outside of Germany.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: Between 100,000 and 200,000 tonnes of feed containing 2 to 10 percent of the potentially contaminated fat were delivered to about 4,800 farms in Germany.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: As a strictly precautionary measure, all farms were blocked;

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: their commercial activity suspended;

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: there were lying... laying hen, fattening poultry, goose, pig, dairy cattle, bovine and rabbit farms.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: Some deliveries of potentially contaminated feed for breeding hens were also made to France and Denmark.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: No food of animal origin from the blocked farms can be placed on the market until the farms are unblocked.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: This can only happen after it is ensured through analytical results and investigations that the farms are not contaminated at levels above those provided by the EU law.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: Currently, from these 4,800 farms that were originally blocked, 939 farms, mostly poultry and pig establishment, remain blocked.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: It appears that no contaminated food was traded or exported from Germany since the incident was notified, with a few exceptions.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: In the end, analytical results showed that the products were compliant with EU legislation.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: This is an example of the effectiveness of the EU's traceability system put in place and we will continue to be vigilant in this respect.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: The fortunate element of this incident is that the observed levels of dioxin of food where EU limits were exceeded have not been very high, which means that no immediate health risk for the consumer is expected as a sesu- as a result of the consumption, if any, of the contaminated products during a short period of time.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: What has the Commission done to help manage the incident?

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: My services have been in constant contact with the German authorities and immediately disseminated all information to Member States through the Rapid Rapid Alarm Systems for Food and Feed.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: They have also been in touch with the competent authorities in third countries, providing a clear picture of the incident to our trade partners.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: Moreover, Commission officials met with stakeholders in the fats and oils industry to explore ways of further strengthening the monitoring of dioxin in foo- in feed.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: I personally contacted the German Federal Minister o- for Food, Agriculture and Consumer Protection, Mrs a- Aigner, on the 6th of of January, and we exchanged views on what needs to be done to avoid similar contamination and incidents in the future.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: Today, I again contacted the German Federal Minister, as I'm concerned by the recent news from the last weekend that a feed manufacturer did not provide a full list of farms which have received potentially contaminated feed, and provided incorrect information as regards the use of contaminated feed fat in compound feed, resulting in an additional blocking of several hundreds of farms.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: This concerns a very serious infringement of EU food safety provisions.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: Let me say it clearly: the German authorities are fully engaged in dealing with this contamination and doing their best to deal with it urgently and decisively.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: I am informed that they are making available additional capacity for testing so that this would be done and finished in the shortest possible time.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: However, it is important that the wider implications for the approach towards the safety of animal feed at EU level are also urgently addressed.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: For this reason, a team from the Food and Veterinary Office will visit Germany next week to assist the German authorities and to inform our overall knowledge and understanding of how this contamination happened and how it can be best avoided in the future.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: The German authorities are informed and agreed to this ehm visit.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: And I know we can count on the full cooperation of our German colleagues.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: An additional information to you, honourable members of Parliament: we'll con- discuss this incident also during the Agricultural Council which will take place in Brussels next Monday, 24th of January.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: As I have already mentioned, we are reflecting on measures including legislative ones.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: The incident has highlighted the necessity to ensure the effectiveness of national control systems which underpin the confidence of all EU Member States and third countries in our food and feed safety measures.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: In order to address this issue, I am exploring the possibility to establish a strict segregation of the production of fats and oils intended for feed and food purposes from the production of fats and oils for technical uses and I am considering the possibility of legal requirements on reinforced controls on dioxins at different stages of the feed chains.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: I am confident that these measures, when endorsed and adopted, will bring the necessary improvements to our already solid food and feed safety systems.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Dalli John
s.text: Thank you for your attention.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: Thank you very much madam President.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: First of all, can I say?, I sympathise totally with the position that the many German farmers find themselves in at this present moment of time.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: I had this experience ehm about 2 years ago in Northern Ireland when we went through a very similar exercise.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: And ehm I tell you it's the people who really suffer in this is the farmers who were actually not involved in any way # and I can # you have.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: Ehm I think the word 'criminal' has been mentioned here, I think there are those with criminal intent who have been involved in this.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: And we have to ask why do they do it, and I have to say Commissioner ehm you know ehm are they doing it to make a lot of money, as Mr Häusling says, a lot of extra money?

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: If they are, they should be prosecuted for it.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: But we should make it very clear: this is not those who are producing food that's responsible.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: It's the providers of the feed to those who are producing the food as responsible.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: And we must take the actions against these people to make sure it doesn't happen and to restore the confidence to the consumer.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: Because I can understand well why the consumer's confidence will be shaken at this moment of time.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: Because, as someone said, this been m- has happened before and it should not be allowed to happen again.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: But let's not ehm simply go wholesale and bring in new legislation.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Nicholson James
s.text: Let's implement what we have.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Agnew John Stuart
s.text: Thank you President.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Agnew John Stuart
s.text: First may I declare an interest:

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Agnew John Stuart
s.text: I am a British egg producer.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Agnew John Stuart
s.text: The dioxin contamination appears to be a consequence of the failure to adhere to the more rigorous processing standards needed for animal feed, as opposed to the less demanding process used to convert rapeseed to biofuel.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Agnew John Stuart
s.text: The EU's enthusiasm for biofuels can therefore have unintended consequences.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Agnew John Stuart
s.text: In my view, this is not a matter for the EU.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Agnew John Stuart
s.text: It will not be solved by, and certainly does not need, extra regulation.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Agnew John Stuart
s.text: The Germans have identified a problem, they have told us about it and they are taking the necessary steps.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Agnew John Stuart
s.text: In the UK, we have a comprehensive assurance scheme called the Lion Code.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Agnew John Stuart
s.text: It covers both animal feed production in the mill and the egg production on the farm, thus ensuring that... incidents like this are highly unlikely.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Agnew John Stuart
s.text: So, if any of you are insistent on top quality eggs, 'ask for the Lion' and British producers will be delighted to supply you.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Agnew John Stuart
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: Thank you madam Chair, Mr Commissioner, dear colleagues.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: The December contamination in Germany that we are discussing today and the blatant breach in our food safety chain observed did not did not only put seriously the health of thousands of consumers at risk, but also revealed remaining weaknesses in our food traceability system.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: It is indeed more than worrying that German authorities, or the Commission themselves, were not able to guarantee that none of the contaminated raw products, such as eggs, entered the food chain by being included as ingredients in processed food.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: Traceability is quite often seen as a burden from the food industry, but it appears crucial that it comes and when it comes to emergency situation such as the one discussed today and should be considered as a prerequisite to protect consumers' health and safety and I would therefore like to ask 2 questions to the Commission.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: First, whether they can now ascertain and confirm that none of the contaminated eggs or their single product affected entered the food chain via their utilisation in processed foods.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: And second, if they intends to reinforce traceability and information measures in order to guarantee an optimal protection of consumers in future food... and sanitary crises.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: # madam President, as we've heard, dioxin is a dangerous chemical which is known to cause cancer, and in this instance, it entered the food chain when chemicals meant for use in biofuels were accidentally used in animal feed.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Some test results by the Agriculture Ministry in Schleswig-Holstein have shown the fat of the feed contained 77 times the approved amount of dioxin.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: The Rapid Alert System for Food and Feed is designed to protect European consumers from exactly this kind of contaminations.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: By the time the alarm was raised, contaminated products were all over Germany... and other parts of the EU, even in UK quiches, which were removed as a precautionary... measure from supermarket shelves.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: This is not the first dioxin scare.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: We've had problems with mozzarella from Italy, pork products in Ireland and cattle products in Northern Ireland.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: What we want to know from the Commission is why this Rapid Alert System mechanism has again failed to protect consumers, and what is the Commission going to do to put it right.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: Ehm in Ireland, 2 years ago, December 2008, we had a problem.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: I wonder what has the Commission done in the 2 years to avoid this current crisis.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: I have a specific question:

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: Member State authorities are crying out for guidelines from DG SANCO on the feed hygiene regulations, they want guidance and a workshop.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: Will you please make a commitment tonight to give them what they are requesting?

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: I have 3 other points to make.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: We need very clearly to identify the high-risk products, the high-risk processors and the location and names of the high-risk producers, and, at the very least, we need total segregation of products that are destined for the animal feed chain and, therefore, for the food chain.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: It is not rocket science.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: We also need, as others have said, controls along the way so that we detect those who will continue to try and break the rules to make money.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: Cutting costs is about cutting corners.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: The problems is it costs Europe billions and millions;

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: it takes away consumer confidence and #...

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Ashworth Richard
s.text: Ehm President thank you very much, ehm we've had a number of incidents like this over the years.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Ashworth Richard
s.text: Ehm and I would have thought that by now, the importance of traceability and quality assurance would be c- well understood and that the structures and regulations ought to be in place to s- to prevent incidence incidents like this.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Ashworth Richard
s.text: This raises a number of very serious concerns.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Ashworth Richard
s.text: Firstly, it's extremely damaging to consumers confidence in the food industry, secondly, it is always the farmers who are the innocent parties here, it's always the farmers who suffer a disproportionate effect ehm when compared to the consequence on the food processing industry.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Ashworth Richard
s.text: Ehm I'm reasonably satisfied that the German authorities, and the Commission ehm and his team, have taken reasonable, appropriate and swift action ehm when they were aware that there was a problem.

text.topicspec: Consequences in the European Union of the dioxin animal feed incident
speaker.name: Ashworth Richard
s.text: But nevertheless, it ehm a number of very serious questions arise: questions about the behaviour of some sectors of the processing industry where, clearly, more needs to be done by way of prevention, more needs to be done by way of pu- punitive powers where the consequence of this action, where the #...

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: Thank you Mr Commissioner.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: The tropical rainforests in Cameroon Cameroon and the Congo are precious and we must welcome this voluntary agreement to address the sustainability of the harvesting of the timber that they contain.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: The forests belong not only to the people of these countries but they are part of the ecosystem of the planet, key to the life-sustaining systems and they contain billions of tonnes of carbon.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: Halting deforestations is one of the ways that we should be ca- tackling climate change, and governments around the globe have been trying to do this for years.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: These 2 countries should be congratulated for their courage and foresight in signing up to these voluntary agreements with the EU.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: However, regulating and enforcing these ingr- agreements will prove a challenge.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: Heaven knows, building in sustainable management of our own continent's resources is hard enough.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: But the will is there and for that we should be very pleased.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: Careful management can bring down illegal and sus- unsustainably imported timber.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: At the moment... th- the amount of timber that is illegally harvested and imported into the EU constitutes almost one fifth of the timber products on our markets, despite the Parliament and others trying to tackle this.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: Enforcement will be made easier with the involvement of local people and the civil society in these countries, and we must ensure that their rights to ehm be heard is involved and involved is maintained and listened to.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: And after they have... after all, they have the most to lose if their forests are removed.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: The widespread removal of tropical timber is driven by an insatiable appetite for products to grace our homes.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: We should value this resource better and take c- greater care of the resource that not only sustains a whole host of planim- plant and animal species but is slow growing and takes many years to reach maturity.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: We must take care not to undermine our own efforts to fight deforestation and climate change while simultaneously providing the largest market for illegally... illegal timber products in the world.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: The result of these agreements may mean that tropical timber reaches a higher price, and that is something that we should not object to.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: It's... not only it is a limited resource, but this is the only thing that local people have to sell.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: They know the true value of their resource and with this agreement, so will we.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: These people are our eyes and ears in the forest and we need to help their help to enforce the agreements.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: They need us to support their ability to voice any concerns.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: These agreements are a two-way process and we look to you, Mr Commissioner, to be able to enforce it.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: The VPAs are good for the planet, good for our partner countries and good for the EU.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: We must ensure that the agreements work and that th- any breaches are monitored and addressed .

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: Then, we must look to other countries in Africa, Asia and South America to sign up to similar agreements as soon as possible and I look forward to working with you ehm as and the Commission to achieving this.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Thank you President, let me begin by thanking Yannick Jadot for his exemplary cooperation with the his shadows.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: We all worked extremely well on this report and I'm delighted, as he has said, that we managed to reach a broad consensus.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: The agreements with...

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Congo and Cameroon, taken together with Ghana, means that some of th- Africa's most vulnerable forests are now covered by Voluntary Partnership Agreements.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: And the existence of these agreements, as my as the 2 previous speakers have said, are to be warmly welcomed.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: They do provide a mechanism for tackling the massive illegal trade in timber.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: They provide an opportunity for the better management of a vital natural resource and they, hopefully, will bring greater transparency ehm and help us tackle corruption in the forestry sector, which, unfortunately in Africa, is at the moment endemic.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: But, while welcoming these agreements, I nevertheless share with the rapporteur a number of concerns and I just wish to express 3 ehm this evening.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: First and foremost, the danger, it's not the intention, but the danger of agreeing such ehm a framework is that it's seen as ehm providing a framework for large-scale exploitation of our forests, leading to the opposite of the purpose of the agreement, which is further degradation, further deforestation, and thus contributing to the very destruction of the global environment we are trying to avoid.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: What we want is an agreement that contributes to the conservation and sustainable management of our biodiversity resources.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: And I agree with the rapporteur that means the Commission has to constantly monitor the situation and report back regularly on how the agreement is progressing.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Secondly, indigenous indigenous people, who are so often the victims of ehm of environmental exploitation, should benefit from this agreement.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: The promise in the Voluntary Partnership Agreement by the Congolese government to promote a law ensuring that the rights of indigenous people are promoted and respected must be delivered upon.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: And again, I urge the Commission, in their contact with the government, to continually press for the delivery of this promise until it's there on the statute book in the Congo.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Thirdly, we must ensure, and I agree with Catherine Bearder, she mentioned this, that appropriate funds are available to properly implement this agreement.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: No matter how good an agreement is on paper, without the resources to carry it out, it is a meaningless piece of paper.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: And, as has been indicated, there are no financial packages attached to the agreement itself.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: It is up to us, both the Commission to propose, Parliament and Council to put into the budget appropriate budgetary facilities to make this agreement work.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: That means we need to have money to verify the legality of timber coming into the European Union, we need money to train, equip and give the technical expertise to those operating on the grounds in the African countries we have VPAs with, and we n- also need to carry out resources to carry out the monitoring that I have already mentioned.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: So we need to make sure, in the coming months, we deliver the financial framework to make a success of these agreements.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: To repeat, these are good agreements but, like all g- agreements, they will depend on the goodwill and vigilance of the individuals, the non-government organisations, the Member States, the Congolese and Cameroon governments, to deliver on their promises to make sure these agreements work in practice.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
