s.text: They should lead to better management of our forests, better management of vital global resource but, if wrongly handled, they could take us in the opposite direction and we look at the Commission to keep a ehm a beady eye on the progress is being made.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Thank you President.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: # general approach of ehm Yannick Jadot to this issue.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: I welcome any agreement that guarantees protection of the rainforests of our planet, if such agreements advance also the protection of the indigenous people of the forest and give a better life to the majority of people in the countries concerned.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: It must be said at the start that both the Republic of Congo and Cameroon have highly repressive governments.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: Cameroon is very high in the Corruption...

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: Index # by Transparency International, in the Republic of Congo there has been horrific exploitation of some sections of the population, notably the pygmy people, although a new law has just been passed and people will wait to see what this brings to protect indigenous people.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: The logging industry in these countries is implicated in the corruption and in the exploitation of workers and the deforestation involved is a huge threat to the livelihoods of the indigenous people.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: It is for this reason that the original resolution of the European United Left Group calls for the logging industry to be in public ownership and under democratic control, crucially involving workers in the industry and the indigenous communities in the forests affected by logging.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: The Left's resolution also points out that illegal logging is related to poverty levels in the countries concerned.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: It can provide an income for individuals and their families which would otherwise go hungry, and therefore, the ending of illegal longing... logging is also linked on the poverty and deprivation of many communities in the relevant countries being addressed.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: This will not be done by the local corrupt elites, nor by European multinational corporations whose key motivation is private profit, but by the forestry workers and the indigenous ehm peoples themselves taking democratic ownership of their resources.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: And in this sense, the people of Sub-Saharan Africa can take inspiration from their brothers and sisters in Tunisia in their heroic struggle against a corrupt dictatorship over the past weeks.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: Thank you ch- ehm President.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: President, honourable members.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I should start with to thank the rapporteur, Mr Jadot, for his support to the Voluntary Partnership Agreement on Forest Law Enforcement , Governance and Trade with Congo and Cameroon.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I hope this House will follow the recommendations for consent to conclude these 2 agreement.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: This will also encourage the Parliament in both Cameroon and Congo to complete their consideration.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It is important that both the European Union and our partner countries endorse the VPA, since illegal logging is a problem for all.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I know that ehm illegal logging is just... the visible tip of the iceberg.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: We are speaking basically to start to work together for sustainable m- management of forest resources.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: And, immediately answering to one of the suggestions by the rapporteur, I could say yes, I am ready to come each 6 months, as the Parliament will call me, and to monitor the implementation these agreements.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It's true that it is engagement.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: There are risks but that's the only way, in my opinion, really to get to sustainable management of this resource, because if we don't do this, just by declarations we will not manage to be successful.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: For our partner countries, there is a lot of engagement, but I believe one of the important is the losses our loss to the illegal logging.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Each year, 10 to 15 billion dollars are lost to revenues.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: For illegal lo- ehm logging has also extremely negative consequences for the indigenous people, as well f- on biodiversity and on climate change.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: And at the same time, it's also to important to emphasise the EU is one of the biggest market for tropical wood.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: That means that our approach is extremely important how the whole issue is being dealt with. 20 percent of tropical wood arrives ehm to EU, that arrives comes from illegal sources, so we have an obligation to ensure that we only source legal wood.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: At the same time also climate change's issue is concern for all, and protection of forests should be started somewhere.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Very simple is sometimes to say that we need to pay for protect the forests: it is f- a simple formula, but to apply it require a lot of engagement from both sides.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I will try to answer a couple of ehm questions that have been put to me.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Well, on enforcement and implementation, ehm VPA establishes a joint implementation Committee which will monitor implementation of the agreement.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It will establish also independent audit which will analyse the legality assurance system, its effectiveness and efficiency.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: And there is also annual reporting mechanism.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: This annual report will be made public and definitely it will be available to the European Parliament.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Also, through our preparation for VPA, we have already engaged that civil society, indigenous people.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Until now, they cam- completely be have been left out from the whole process, so we have agreed that the new agreements, set to set up multi-stakeholder Committees to monitor, or guide, the implementation where indigenous people are involved.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: There is also a complaint mechanism included in the VPAs, and the independent auditor will have access to, and rely upon, information from a wide array of sources, including from civil society and communities.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It's definite a cost also of resources.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Between 2002 and 2008, the EU contributed 544 million euro to forestry in general in developing world, some of it directed to FLEGT work in individual countries.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: The Commission has so far spent a further 35 million to support the FLEGT more generally, and we will spend 35 million more between 2011 and 2013.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I would like to also emphasise that Member States also make fiscal contribution.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: We also have dedicated human resources to implementation of FLEGT.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: We I have 7 civil servants that are dealing with this, and they are working closely with the European Forest Institute, national forest authorities.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: We have also ehm some additional effort from recent adopted Illegal Timber Regulation, ehm from 2010 as a key element of FLEGT action plan, and this will complement the VPA approach.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It will discourage unregulated, unsustainable exploitation of forests.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: The recent agreement at Cancún on actions to reduce emissions due to the deforestation and forest degradation will facilitate further support by the Commission to developing countries.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Our future work on forest governance through VPAs will be helped by the fact that REDD makes provisions for governance and respect of indigenous peoples' rights and members of local communities.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I take note about ehm human rights situation in parti- partner countries.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I agree with the draft motion for a resolution that the Commission should keep focusing on the issues.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I can assure you that we keep human rights issues in the centre of our political dialogue with the partner countries, and I can assure you that fighting in the corruption is one of the ehm issues that we address dealing with the partner countries.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: But I would emphasise one particular point that... made a lot of encouragement to s- the whole process: the partner countries feel engaged.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: And without real engagement from our partner countries, with all the weaknesses the administrations have, we can't more really to protect the forests.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I know that this is only the start of the process, but it is a start of the process that is shared by both sides, and I am ready always to come to Parliament to answer how this implementation is going.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: But definitely, with FLEGT, we don't make a wrong step.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It's a step in the right deci- direction: we do not increase the risk.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Perhaps we don't provide sufficient solutions, but at least it is a decent step that we can be proud of.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: # -dent, we're debating Voluntary Partnership Agreements.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: They're lovely words, they're good words: they represent a European Union which isn't trying to impose its will upon developing nations but is trying to lend a helping hand to achieve common goals.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: But the p-... practicalities of an agreement with a State the size of Congo create all sorts of... all sorts of daunting problems.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: The size of the State alone: something akin to Europe;

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: the governance for much of that State: non-existent;

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: corruption levels, quite extraordinary:

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: Transparency International puts the Congo almost bottom of its league table.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: The number of staff we have, working to ensure that this go- this agreement delivers on its goals: just a handful of people;

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: the profits of illegal logging: absolutely vast and perhaps greater than anything we can offer by way of compensation;

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: and the markets for illegal wood: from countries like China, which are perhaps not paying anything like the attention that we are paying, to the res- to res- and and respect that should be paid, to maintaining forests.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: And all these all these problems suggest that voluntary partnerships, however good our intentions, will have difficulty in delivering the goals.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: So what assurances can the Commission give us that every step possible will be taken to ensure that the high ambitions we are setting here will truly be realised, and that we can all have confidence that these Voluntary Partnership Agreements, as we make them in future, will deliver upon the goals... we seek?

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: # scandals of the 20th century was the continuous and systematic chopping down of forests, especially in the Third World, done by individuals who knew no better and cannot be faulted, but by big be- ehm... greedy businesses and corrupt governments.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: And that's why this ehm agreement is to be welcomed wholeheartedly and I hope it will be implemented, because if it isn't, it won't be worth the paper it is written on.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: On the broader front, we also have to ensure that other policies of the European Union do not contribute ehm to continued deforestation.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: I in particular refer to the pro- proposed agreement on Mercosur which many people feel will encourage farmers to chop down the forests in those countries so they can export agricultural products into Europe.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: So we have to be vigilant.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: # President, honourable members, definitely the debate went beyond the scope of ehm this Voluntary Partnership Agreement.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: If we look at the forest, it's not only trade that affects the forest, it's also is energy resource of these countries, it's also growing populations that make an impact on the forest.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: So ehm again I would like to emphasise is a first step of engagement in only one of the areas.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I know that it's not solution, but you start somewhere to get into the issue.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Also, I would not discourage you about the engagement of the countries.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I know that sometimes these countries are far from simple, but the countries have a rather difficult history.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: They got their independence 50 years ago, but not exactly in the situation as some of our countries got independence, so it takes time.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It takes time to establish State institution really to fight corruption or establish also management of resources, and they are on this way.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: If we see Africa, in particular, there have been economic growth even in the times of the crisis.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It means it's getting stronger and getting better.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I know that it's only one indicator, but if we see that the overall tendency, there have been some encouraging news, and the only way we can improve this process is working together.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: And that's where we come with sustainable forest management: it's Congo-Brazzaville and Cameroon today, we are working with DRC, we are working also with Indonesia.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It's not... it's still th-... we are negotiating but ehm with good hopes to conclude it.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: So I would say the risks with this I think is is very minimal.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Engagement is where we starting.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: So I would really would look on this process as very positive.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Also we should look on the global engagement in fighting s- climate change.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Cancún gave some assurances that other parts of the world take things also seriously.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It's not that only we would like that world will be fair and sustainable, other parts of the world well learn from it.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Let's take, for example, energy efficiency drives.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: We started here, well, other parts have followed into the matter.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: The same resource efficiency.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: If we would use less timber, definitely other parts would also learn this.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: So I believe there is a lot of way how we could lead.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: And last but not least, I again would like to to give the guarantee that Commission will monitor, not only by the staff I have, but we have EU delegations, we have Member State delegations.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It's one of the process where which we share with Member States.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It's not only Commission alone working, because in a lot of cases, particular Member States' experience was crucial to conclude this Voluntary Partnership Agreement.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I would ask this House really very much to deal with this consent to this process because I believe it's healthy process, it goes in the right direction and, at the same time, doesn't provide not provide the answers on all the issues that you have raised today.

text.topicspec: EU Cameroon forest law agreement EU Republic of Congo forest law agreement FLEGT voluntary partnership agreements
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Thank you very much President, firstly, let me say that I know that Commissioner De Gucht, for good reasons, can't be with us this evening and I want to thank him for taking the trouble to call me last week and explain why he's unable to to be with us.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Ehm and in his absence I would like to thank him and his team at DG Trade for their cooperation, in particular, Martin Dihm ehm for all his assistance.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: I've tried, in my role as rapporteur, to follow on the good work in the previous rapporteur, my former colleague Glyn Ford.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: I'm fortunate in the adoption of Glyn's resolution in 2009 meant that Parliament already had a clear position on the EC-Pacific Interim Economic Partnership Agreement and Parliament's position formal position then is the one that I've tried to to follow in my report and question today.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: I'd also like to thank Donatella Pribaz, who was the Committee's administration responsible and this turned out to be her last report for the Committees before her promotion, so I'd like to wish her well in her new job and thank her for making my... task here easier.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: And finally, in terms of acknowledgements , I would also ehm welcome the presence of the Ambassador from Papua New Guinea here and thank him and his staff for their close collaboration as well ehm and the insights they provided allowed me to put a specific ehm input into this report.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: I'd like to firstly make a few general remarks on the agreement and the regional context.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: And then secondly, I plan to discuss 3 specific aspects of the EPA which I believe are important to highlight: firstly, Aid for Trade, the Fijian political situation and finally fisheries.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: And then thirdly, I will comment on the future of the EC-Pacific trading relations.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Firstly in terms of the the background and regional integration, this interim, or goods only, EPA has been negotiated with only 2 Pacific States:

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Papua New Guinea and Fiji.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: These are the 2 Pacific island States with the highest level of trade with the EU and have key imports desti- key exports destined to the EU market: tuna and sugar respectively.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: The EPA gives Papua New Guinea and Fiji duty-free and quota-free access to the EU market in return for the gradual liberalisation of their markets over a 15-year period.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: PNG has committed to liberalise 88 percent of EU imports on the da- date of application of this agreement, and Fiji will liberalise 87 percent over a 15-year period.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: The remaining 12 Pacific States either enjoy duty-free and quota-free access through the Everything But Arms scheme or, ehm because of their ehm low level of trade ehm with the EU, have very liv- little interest in carrying out ehm an interim EPA.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Nevertheless, I believe that it's important that, as we move towards a full EPA, that we pursue our objective of regional integration and continue to press for a full EPA that involves all the Pacific ehm States.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: In terms of the... content of the resolution, ehm Parliament of course has to give consent to this agreement before it can be ratified.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: And we'll vote on...

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Wednesday, as you've indicated madam President, on 2 different reports, firstly, on the consent ehm agreement, which I'm recommending that we... give, ehm and secondly on the accompanying motion for resolution.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Ehm and there are other items in the motion for a resolution but, as I've said, I want to comment particularly on 3.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Firstly, in terms of Aid for Trade.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Funding for implementation is key to achieving the objectives of the agreement of economic diversification and poverty alleviation.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: It's important that a fair and equitable share of the si- of the 2 billion set aside in the 2007 Aid for Trade strategy is directed towards the Pacific region.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: It's important to highlight this interim EPA was conceived as a short-term measure to safeguard the Pacific's trade preferences following the WTO's ruling.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Bearing that in mind, it should be s- it should not be seen as a sign of acceptance on the side of the EU of the political regime in Fiji.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: I would urge the Fijian government to make moves towards democracy and I hope that the necessary reforms can take place to allow financial support for the Fijian sugar industry to be allocated.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: On fishing.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Fisheries sector plays a key role in the PNG economy and, importantly, provides employment and income to PNG citizens.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: In the 3 tuna processing plants which export to the EU, there are 5,700 employees, the majority of whom are woman.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: And this is a country where it's difficult sometimes to find good employment for women.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: I support the purpose of the flexible rules of origin within this agreement to develop the processing industry, but it's essential that the industry develops in a sustainable manner.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Environmental considerations are paramount and I've asked, in my report, that the Commission monitors and regularly reports back to the Parliament on c- compliance with the regulation on illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: I appreciate there are some concerns within this House, and specifically in the Fishing Subcommittee, of the potential impact of the PNG tuna imports to the EU industry.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: When we look at the latest figures, though, we can see that during the period 2003 - 2009, PNG import made up around only 2 percent of total preserved and prepared fish imports and around only 3 percent of pr- preserved and prepared tuna imports.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: I do not believe that this low level of imports will threaten domestic EU industrial capacity, a- a- a- th- th- th- sorry will threaten domestic e- EU industry especially if we take into account the limited fishing capacity of Pacific States' fishing fleets and the limited on-land processing capacity.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Nevertheless, of course, it's right that we should continue to monitor the situation and that, if there are any unexpected increases in fishing products coming from Papua New Guinea, that the Commission should take appropriate action.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: As I also mentioned earlier, I hope the Pacific States can agree a comprehensive regional EPA.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: In my report, I've recommended the inclusion of several points of substance in future negotiations, which I hope the Commission will take into account.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: These include intellectual property.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: We too often ehm talk about intellectual property from one side only, ehm but I hope we will look at intellectual property in terms of including traditional knowledge.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: I hope we'll add transparency in government procu- procurement and provision for issuing working visas up to 24 months.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Ehm as we move towards a full EPA, I had other things to say too, but I see I've run out of time, # towards a full EPA, I hope the Commission will involve all ehm i- Pacific States, but, in the interim, let's press ahead and get this EPA with the interim EPA with the ehm PNG and Fiji on the books and working as a demonstration of what we can achieve in the future.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Thank you Chair.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: President, honourable members, I would like to thank the rapporteur for his report and particularly for his ehm positive attitude give consent ehm for the Interim Economic Partnership Agreement with the Pacific States of Papua New Guinea and Fiji.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I hope that this House ehm well ehm will follow his advice.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Consent by the European Parliament, the first on the trade agreement under the Lisbon Treaty, has important political significance because this is a trade agreement with a long-term development focus and because of the momentum it will provide to ongoing negotiations on the comprehensive EPA with the Pacific region.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Back in 2007, the immediate purpose of the interim agreement was to secure continued access to the EU market for those countries in the Pacific region that depend on it most, given the impending expiry of the Cotonou trade regime.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: The Commission's commitment to conclude negotiations on a comprehensive EPA with the Pacific region as a whole remains unchanged and we are presently engaged in negotiations with our Pacific partners.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: We can g- go forward only if we accept the special nature of the Pacific region and tailor the EPA accordingly.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: We are talking about small and remote island States which differ greatly in their economic situation, development needs and relations with the EU.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Some countries have 'least developed country' status and are therefore covered by the EU's Everything But Arms trade regime;

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: some have little, if any, trade with the European Union.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: We are therefore open to enter into the trade relationships that best suit the Pacific region as a whole, and the ongoing negotiations will inform the ultimate choices.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Whatever approach we opt for, it is absolutely crucial to ensure that any agreement will indeed contribute to the development of the countries concerned.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: This is why there is also a financial assistance to enhance trade capacity.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: This is also why we will allow partner countries in the developing world to exclude more sensitive products from the trade agreements, which we would not allow other countries to do.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: In this context, I have o- duly taken note of the concerns expressed about the derogation from the standard rules of origin from fishery products in the Interim EPA.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It is precisely for development reasons that we granted this derogation and this was done on the basis of our informed judgement that Papua New Guinea's small market share makes it unlikely that their tuna exports could hurt the interests of the EU industry.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: The European Union and PNG have provisionally applied these rules since 2008 and, whereas export figures have fluctuated, no upward trend has been detected.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Let me also assu- reassure you that the Commission does not has the intention to offer similar arrangement to any other region.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: The Commission will, in any event, closely monitor the implementation of the derogation and will report to Parliament on the basis of a study which will be prepared before the end of 2011.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Some of you have been also present in September last year when the current electing Prime Minister addressed the INTA Committee.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: He expressed the readiness of his government to grant access to EU vessels and investors to Papua New Guinea's waters.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: We take this oral declaration very seriously and we'll continue to engage with our partners to it come to the fruti- fruition .

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: The European Parliament's consent will allow us to launch the implementation mechanisms foreseen in the agreement;

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: one of them is the Trade Committee, which could be convened this spring and which provides a platform to raise all issues relating to mutual obligations under the Interim EPA.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Your vote is therefore key to help us move forward on this and other important issues.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: With regards to Fiji, the country did sign the Interim EPA but does not apply it provisionally.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: This makes Papua New Guinea the only country presently applying... presently provisionally applying the EU-Pacific Interim EPA.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Fiji continues to have access to the EU market under the Market Access Regulation for the time being, since the Council has not adopted trade sanctions.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: As you are aware, the EU decided to suspend development aid to Fiji because of the political situation in the country.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Resumption of aid would presuppose progress in governance in Fiji and, in particular, a return to democratic principles of government, but there is no tangible progress in this regard in Fiji at the moment.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: The EPA we discuss today is only an interim arrangement to ensure that access to the EU market would not be lost.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: The Commission is fully committed to continue negotiations on a comprehensive EPA with the Pacific region.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Thank you for your attention.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Andrikiené Laima Liucija
s.text: Thank you Mr President, being shadow rapporteur of the EPP...

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Andrikiené Laima Liucija
s.text: I would like to start by saying that we welcome the increasing role of the EU as a trading power in every region of the world, including the Pacific region.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Andrikiené Laima Liucija
s.text: The agreement, as it is now, is not a perfect one, not least because it is not a comprehensive EPA, but only an interim one.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Andrikiené Laima Liucija
s.text: We hope that the Commission will be in the position to negotiate, in due time, a com- comprehensive EPA including in this a larger number of countries in the region.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Andrikiené Laima Liucija
s.text: Secondly, the current ehm agreement concerns only a small part of EU trade, since the share of EU's trade with the whole of the Pacific region is just 0.06 percent, and yet some areas have caused concern for us, most notably on the issue with the derogation from the r- rules of origin for fishery products.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Andrikiené Laima Liucija
s.text: In our resolution, we raise our concern that a number of countries, such as Philippines, Thailand, China, the United States, Australia and others, will be able to take advantage of this derogation and potentially export large quantities of processed fisheries... products to the EU, potentially harming the interests of the EU fish processing and canning industry.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Andrikiené Laima Liucija
s.text: Finally, we therefore encourage the Commission to act upon the Parliament's request to conduct an impact assessment study and, in the event that the assessment report demonstrates a destabilising effect on the unfinishing on the EU's fishing processing and canning industry, to initiate the procedure leading to the suspension of the exceptional arrangements we regard in the rules of origin in this agreement.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Andrikiené Laima Liucija
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Lövin Isabella
s.text: Thank you Mr President.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Lövin Isabella
s.text: Ehm one of the objectives of the EPAs is to promote regional integration.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Lövin Isabella
s.text: What we've seen so far is this is not happening.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Lövin Isabella
s.text: On the contrary, the EU is disintegrating unity by offering interim agreements to some ACP countries, with special conditions attached.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Lövin Isabella
s.text: For example, the derogation of the rules of origin for fish that is processed in PNG and Fiji.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Lövin Isabella
s.text: I believe this derogation is potentially hazardous and it must be thoroughly evaluated in 2011, as already agreed.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Lövin Isabella
s.text: I'm saying that because it's important to have facts when we're discussing this.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Lövin Isabella
s.text: What are the effects on the global fish stocks, on illegal fisheries, on employment and environment in PNG?

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Lövin Isabella
s.text: And what are the social conditions for the workers?

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Lövin Isabella
s.text: All this must be fully and transparently assessed, and then the derogation may or may not be abolished based on that and not on the complaints for the European fishing industry that, themselves, fish in PNG and that never land the fish there and that thereby not contribute to ehm work in the country.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Lövin Isabella
s.text: And they, by the way, don't pay customs when they sell the fish as domestic on the European market.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: Thank you Mr President, I actually came down to participate in the next debate but I've been watching this debate from my office ehm and I'm concerned, as others have debated here, on the idea of flexibility on our rules of origin.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: In the last ehm 7 days, there's been a programme on ehm British television, Channel 4, of a whole series about the fishing industry, and, I'm afraid, the European Union's fisheries policy has come in for severe criticism, and we're getting lots of e-mails from concerned citizens.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: This issue didn't arise, but can I just stand and support those colleagues who have expressed huge concern about ehm a proposal that is supposed to be positive ehm as a development tool but, in fact, could be n- quite negative, not just from a European perspective, but also for the very country we are trying to assist.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: President, it was extremely interesting debate and I will start saying, well, there is a poverty in the world.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: We need to deal with this.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: One path is we transfer ehm f- financial sources, money, but ehm it's much better really to give the people opportunities for the work, for they can make a decent living from the work they do.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Just to mention that the 3 tuna processing facilities in Papua New Guinea, which are authorised to export tuna to the EU, employ around 5,700 persons and most of them are women.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It's their jobs that are on stake in s- Papua New Guinea and it is one of the... most poverty-stricken countries.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Commission, when it proposes derogation, took the due respect on the risks involved and made the safeguards.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: 'Cause the Commission is there of the view that, given the low volume of trade between Papua New Guinea and the EU and the low market share of Papua New Guinea in the EU market for tuna, around 3 percent in recent years and provisional application is already from 2008, so that means that we have some experience with figures.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Any, any serious disturbance of the EU's fishing and canning industry by Papua New Guinea export is highly unlikely.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: So it will make no perturbation neither for European fishing... industry neither for canning industry.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: The development of trade flows will be further analysed in a study on the effect of the implementation of the special rules of origin for fishery products which will be prepared in 2011.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: In addition, the Commission will monitor the trade with PNG and will not hesitate to take appropriate measures in case... a serious disturbance of the EU market becomes evident.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: The Interim Agreement explicitly allows for the application of such measures in its Chapter 2 on trade defence instruments.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: There is no indication at this stage of any negative impact of Papua New Guinea's exports of fishery products on the canning industry in other ACP or GSP+ countries.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: This aspect also will be looked into the study I just mentioned.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: I should like to add that, independently of any special rules of origin or preferential trade agreements, countries and companies exporting fish or fishery products to the EU will always have to comply with the regulation on illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing and with the EU's health and food safety requirements.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: So, I believe that it's really Commission has made very proper judgement before presupposing this measure.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Now, a more broader issue on EPA in general.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Well, trade is far from simple say.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: But as I told, the only way really to eradicate poverty, it's allow the growth in the developing world.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It's true that regional cooperation starts rather difficult.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It's not just trade agreements that make this ehm regional development.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: That's why, for Oceania region, we have 45 million euro for trade for aid.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: It's a 3 # compared with 9th EDF.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Because only facilitating trade flows, you can expect regional trade.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: And if we see all developing countries, basically all the trade based on monoculture: one culture, one particular export item with a high fluctuation's rate that makes a huger effect on perturbation in the countries.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: When we talk about migratory flows, when we talk about security, safety and justice in the world, it can't just be the:

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: "Well, we don't care about it".

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: We should care about it, and our service made a very proper study.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: We propose very decent measures 'cause have completely # with all the objectives of the the European Union.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: So, I believe that measure is right and safeguards are in place in case anything goes wrong.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: So, that's what I believe, it's a really proper judgement from our side and I would like really to to to support ehm and to give consent for this agreement.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Piebalgs Andris
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Thanks very much President, I will be brief.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: I find myself in almost, not almost in fact, I think I find myself in total agreement with the ehm Commissioner on this subject.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Firstly, to repeat, it's important that we sign the Interim EPA because, if we don't, existing trade preferences for Papua New Guinea and Fiji will disappear under the WTO ruling.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: So, it's important we sign the Interim EPA.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: The Interim EPA is exactly that: it's interim, and I agree with all the colleagues who say that our objective in the long run should be a full, comprehensive EPA with all the Pacific countries, encouraging regional integration in the Pacific.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: But we have to take this step at the moment to ensure the continuation of preferences for the 2 largest countries in the Pacific region.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: On fishing... the Commission has made it very clear that this is an exception.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: This will be the only derogation.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: There are no other parts of the world we're talking about giving such a derogation.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Why are we giving a derogation to ehm Papua New Guinea?

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: I'll tell you why: it's because it's literally on the other side of the world, ehm and... the likelihood of EU fishing fleets exploiting that area extensively is limited, but they are free to do so.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: There is nothing to stop EU fishing fleets fishing in the Papua New Guinea waters and landing their catch and getting their catch canned in Papua New Guinea, and that, as has been said earlier, would be very good for development, and indeed we should encourage it.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: But the situation at the present time is Chinese boats, Thai boats, boats of other Asian nationalities fish in Papua New Guinean waters and they land their fish back in their own country, giving no opportunity for development in Papua New Guinea.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: This is a development opportunity to provide jobs, particularly for women.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: And we often complain that our development policy, that we do not do enough to encourage downstream activity.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Here, we're actually doing something positive for downstream activity.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: As the Commissioner has said, to qualify, the fish still has to meet all the ehm standards under the regulation on illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: It has to meet all our sanitary and phytosanitary conditions, ehm absolutely essential .

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: The 3 factories in Papua New Guinea meet these standards at the moment, are providing useful jobs.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: If we have a sudden increase in the number of ehm factories, if we have a sudden import, sudden surge in imports from Papua New Guinea, then, of course, we'll have to revisit the situation and potentially ehm take action.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: But at the moment, the statistics speak for themselves.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: This agreement has been in place from 2008.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: There has been no surge.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: There is no threat to the European tuna industry.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: I have met with the , as rapporteur, with the leaders of the Spanish tuna industry and they themselves have said to me there is no current threat.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: What they are worried about, Mrs Fraga, what they claim to worry about is the future.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: They accept that, at the moment, there is no serious threat to the EU industry.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: So let's not exaggerate the situation.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Let's not make a poor developing country pay for our preoccupation with our own self-interest.

text.topicspec: Interim Partnership Agreement between the EC and the Pacific States
speaker.name: Martin David
s.text: Thank you very much.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Thank you Mr President and thank you for bringing forward ehm an important question.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm the protection and the promotion of children's right is a priority for the European Commission, ehm and especially so since the launch of the communication 'Toward an EU strategy on the rights of the child' in 2006.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The strategy on the rights of the child pays... due attention to the fundamental rights of children, including the protection of the best interests of the child enshrined in the European Charter of Fundamental Rights.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The Commission is determined to ensure that all fundamental rights encompassed in the Charter are duly respected by all EU actions, both legislative and non-legislative.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: This practice will be... upheld and further developed in the upcoming communication on the right of the child that that the Commission will put forward this year.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The Commission will also report annually on progress made on the application of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights starting in tw- this year 2011.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm we have to remember that the provisions of the Charter are addressed to the institutions and bodies of the Union, with due regard for the principle of subsidiarity, and to the Member States, only when they are implementing Union law.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm and in this respect, it has to be recalled that, currently, no European Union legislation on international adoption exist.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The subject is regulated by the Hague Convention of May 29 1993 on protection of children and cooperation in respect to inter-country... inter-country adoption, and by national laws.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The Convention to which all Member States of European Union are party... but not the EU, is aimed at implementing Article 21 of the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child by establishing safeguards to ensure that inter-country adoptions take place in the best interests of the child and with respect to child's fundamental rights.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: At international level, the Commission supports the accession of third countries to the '93 Hague Convention on inter-country adoption and its correct implementation by par- by participating in the relevant meetings of the... ehm contracting parties.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The Commission does not consider it necessary to have specific European rules concerning intra-EU adoptions, in light of the ehm fact that all EU member countries, all 27 countries are parties of the Hague Convention.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: This being said, the Commission is following closely the issue of international adoption within the European Union, given the link between adoption and children's li- ehm rights, and the Commission has... taken steps to... assess in com- in ehm to see how c- countries are implementing ehm the ehm... convention on adoption, and providing a forum for exchange of views on that... ehm just a year ago... in November 2000, a little bit more than a year ago, in November 2009.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm the Commission's Green Paper on the free circulation of public doc- documents, presented on December 14 2010 , addresses the lack of mutual recognition of adoption decisions as civil status acts between Member States and its impact on the freedom of movement of u- EU citizens, as a specific step that addresses the question raised today.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Yannakoudakis Marina
s.text: # adoption is a positive way of providing a new family for children who cannot be bought up by their birth parents, or indeed lose their parents.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Yannakoudakis Marina
s.text: To adopt a child in the UK, checks and vetting procedures are robust and prospective parents need to be expe- accepted by an adoption... agency.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Yannakoudakis Marina
s.text: At the heart of the adoption process is and should be the welfare of the child.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Yannakoudakis Marina
s.text: The issue of inten- inter-country adoption are ma- more complex than national adoption, but I'm very grateful to the EPP for bringing this issue forward.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Yannakoudakis Marina
s.text: Whilst it is to be commended that we try and move forward in it, I have concerns that international adoption does bring risks: risks that have already been mentioned, such as child abuse and malpractice, that undermine the welfare of the child.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Yannakoudakis Marina
s.text: That is why I believe that all Member States need to ensure that their adoption laws are regulated in a way that promote the interests of the child.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Yannakoudakis Marina
s.text: Member States must work together to ensure the legal process of... adoption ehm between the providing and receiving countries is transparent, robust and holds the child's welfare as its priority.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: Thank you President.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: Ehm in Ireland, the motto of the International Adoption Association is that families are made in many ways.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: And I think the debate tonight reflects the ehm interest that there is in adoption.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: There are over 1,200 members of that Association: many have adopted and some wish to adopt.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: Our attitudes to adoption have changed utterly.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
