s.text: In Ireland, we come from a past where mothers, particularly single mothers, their babies were taken from them and given away to others to be adopted.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: And it's not ehm a good history, but it certainly has now conditioned how we think of adoption and the child must be at the centre of us.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: Certainly, the birth families are very very important in all of this.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: But equally, we have a duty and a responsibility to give the very best possible homes to all our children.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: And I think that each Member State, and that is how it should operate, ehm needs to protect children within their own borders.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: And Europe should provide a coordinating role and I hope that in Ireland, we do have a referendum on the rights of the child.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: We talk about it a lot, but we're not as as effective in actually dealing with it.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: But I'm, but I am hopeful that the referendum will happen and the situation will certainly improve.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: But it's been a really really useful debate and I thank colleagues for it.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: I think the greatest gift that we can give to any child is that of ehm a happy home and for most children they find that in their own home with their natural parents.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: For many though, they get it ehm with their adoptive parents.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: I think either is preferable to institutional life, provided, of course, there is no corruption or exploitation involved.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: Find the balance is very difficult, but I think that we need to, while considering ehm the Hague Convention, et cetera, where there are prospective adoptive parents who've bona fides, are beyond reproach, so they should be facilitated more in giving the gift of a happy home to a child who hasn't otherwise got it, and not encumbering them with ehm lengthy, expensive, drawn-out processes.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: We need to get the balance right because I, as a teacher, came across many adopted children and the vastest majority were in very good homes.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: Thank you very much.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: Thank you Mr President, Commissioner, dear colleagues, the wide range of instruments which currently govern international adoptions has led to confusion over whose role it is to safeguard the rights of children subject to international adoptions.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: The Commission needs to focus further on the competent authorities and ensure that those regulating the adopters' and the adopted children's rights are making sure that basic minimum standards are adhered to, and that, in the longer term, the child is able to maintain a link to its birth country and its culture.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: Specifically, urgent measures must be taken to react to the f- the abuse and trafficking in- of children, which, as a report in my own country today shows, is alarmingly on the rise both within and across European borders.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: Child trafficking and child laundering, the stealing of children who are subsequently sold to adoptive parents as legitimate orphans, is ehm a phenomenon which does not receive adequate attention at an international level.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Bearder Catherine
s.text: I'd call on the Commission to play a more active role in the field of international adoption and to take concrete steps to improve the convoluted and confused legislative framework which currently governs international adoption in the EU, and to protect those most vulnerable young people.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: Thank you Mr President # your attention on the practice of illegal adoption.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: There is an organised crime network in Europe, and especially in south-east Europe, which is dealing with this and there are hundreds... of... children which are illegally adopted or put for trade.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: And... everything that we succeeded here in the Parliament, to have just a small recital on this issue under the human trafficking Directive.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: And I... call on the European Commission to take a special... measures for preventing this horrible crime, but also for punishing the perpetrators.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: And we could not cope, country by country, at national level, with this very vicious practice.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: It is organised crime and I insist that it should be sorted out at EU level.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Parvanova Antonyia
s.text: Thank you very much.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: # to ehm add something about kinship care and the support to kinship carers.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Most kinship carers are grandparents and find themselves the main caregivers for their grandchildren, normally because the parent has either a drug addiction or has died through that drug addiction.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: And the issue I wanted to bring to this House attention is the good work that the Mentor UK have been doing on the rights of kinship carers.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Some kinship carers do adopt their grandchildren.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Others ehm don't, are in a caring relationship with that child and provide a stable and safe home for that child.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: However, the rights of kinship children are actually less than those of the children that are actually in proper care.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: And this is something which I felt people have touched upon in this debate, but I w- I would urge you, if you're interested in the issue of kinship carers, to look at the work of Mentor UK and the help that's given to kinship carers in different countries.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Thank you Mr President.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm let me first join those who expressed thanks to ehm Ms Angelilli for ehm initiating a very rich debate this evening.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: And in closure I would like to make 5 points.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: First, the Commission fully agrees with the views that have been expressed on the importance to protect and promote the rights of children in inter-country adoptions.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: This is, and will remain, the main objective of the Commission in our participation in discussions on this topic, both in the context of the Hague Convention and in our work on the rights of children in Europe and in ehm with regard to that let me ehm elaborate on 2 points.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm first, in the ehm forthcoming communication on children's right this year, we'll present actions in favour of of the rights of child for the period 2011 - 2014 , among which there will be actions on how to improve the support the Commission provides to Member States in the implementation of the United Nations Conventions on the Rights of of Child.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: And second, as I mentioned ehm in the Green Paper, we are ehm putting forward ehm steps that w- an initiative that will facilitate the circulation of civil status acts a- as adoption decisions: in other wo- w- words, mutual recognition of national adoption decisions within the EU.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: My second point ehm is on the concerns of the MEPs that the issue is sensitive and should be seen in context of national needs and national legislations, and on that point ehm the Commission would like to underline that the Romanian law on international adoptions is the sole responsibility of the Romanian government.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: This measure that has been taken must be seen in connection with the... ehm abus- ehm abusive practices in inter-country adoptio- adoption in this country, in Romania in the past.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The Commission is closely following ongoing developments in ehm the Romanian ehm legislation, but I would like to stress again it is Romania's sol- sole responsibility to ehm further evolve this this law.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: My third point concerns monitoring.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: It is our strong belief that the appropriate institution is the Special Commission of the Hague Convention ehm on Protection of Children and Cooperation in respect of Inter-Country Inter-Country Adoption.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm this this oversight this monitoring body is one that the Commission participates in.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Many of the points that have been made this evening we will consider as part of ehm our deliberations on how we participate in in in the in the work of this body.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: My fourth point concerns accreditation.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The consi- Commission considers accreditation to be a matter of ehm of of ehm g- of national m- Member State authority as part of family laws that Member States ehm have and develop, and my and and therefore it is appropriate to be addressed at that level.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: And my fifth and final point is that I'm very grateful that I have been here on behalf of the Commission this evening.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: I will convey to Vice-President Reding the points that have been made, including a question that has been raised here by one of the MEPs that that an answer is expected.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: And I want to to finish by saying that ehm, as a ehm godmother of an adopted boy, I saw how emotional and difficult this question of adoption is and how many entry points there are to des- to a decision to adopt.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm and I want to say that I have listened to the to the con- to the debate this evening here and not only with great interest, ehm but also with a sense that that, yes indeed, it is a matter of hearts and minds, not just of legislation.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm and therefore ehm let's pray that the hearts and minds are deployed on that matter in the way that best protects the interests of of kids, our kids and kids of ehm other countries.

text.topicspec: International adoption in the European Union
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Watson Graham
s.text: # statement about the plight of hundreds of thousands of airline passengers in Europe in the 10 days before Christmas and the chaos in the arrangements for transporting them and their baggage to their intended destinations.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Watson Graham
s.text: The failure of our airlines and our airports to deal with a few centimetres of snow in a few Member States caused devastating delay, disruption and despair for travellers.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Watson Graham
s.text: And I call on Parliament's Transport Committee, on the Union's Transport Commissioner and transport ministers in Council to conduct an inquiry into the disruption, to make provisions to prevent its recurrence, to ensure that those affected are properly compensated and to study a sharing of the burden of compensation in future between the airline companies and others involved, such as airport operators.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Watson Graham
s.text: President, unusual snowfalls and uncommonly low temperatures, as predicted in 2009 by the Potsdam Institute, arise from the melting of the Arctic ice cap.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Watson Graham
s.text: They will become more frequent.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Watson Graham
s.text: We cannot prevent them, however much we must try to limit them, but we can, and we must, be prepared for them.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Werthmann Angelika
s.text: # President, dear colleagues, with regard to Article 18 of the Declaration of Human Rights and to Article 10 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, I was informed that, on Christmas Day, a massive abuse of religious freedom took place in the Church of Saint Synesios in the occupied Rizokarpaso.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Werthmann Angelika
s.text: The so-called authorities, supported by Turkey, had stopped the Saturday service on the pretext that no application had been made to hold the mass that day, albeit according to the Church of Cyprus, such permission is and has been asked for the last 36 years at the beginning of December.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Werthmann Angelika
s.text: Mr President, I strongly encourage you to take the appropriate steps to guarantee religious freedom on the soil of a European Member State.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Werthmann Angelika
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kasoulides Ioannis
s.text: On Christmas Day, Mr President, the Turkish Security forces in Rizokarpaso, in the occupied part of Cyprus, interrupted by force the ongoing Christmas mass celebrated by the few remaining, elderly Christians, evicted the priests from the church and ordered the congregation to leave.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kasoulides Ioannis
s.text: The excuse was that they had written permission for Sunday's mass, Christmas was on Saturday.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kasoulides Ioannis
s.text: Demanding written permission for mass is a restriction of the freedom of religion in itself, let alone to interrupt the Christmas Day mass on the grounds of a bureaucratic petty excuse: all this in a Member State of the Union, by ordinance of a country aspiring to join it.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kasoulides Ioannis
s.text: There were 12,000 Greek Cypriots enclaved in the Karpass Peninsula, allowed to live there after the Turkish invasion, according to the Vienna Agreement.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kasoulides Ioannis
s.text: They are today 300.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kasoulides Ioannis
s.text: Now you understand why.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Tremosa i Balcells Ramon
s.text: Dear colleagues, I would like to express some concerns on the agreement between the EU and Morocco.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Tremosa i Balcells Ramon
s.text: The future of the agriculture sectors in the Euro-Mediterranean countries will be affected seriously if this agreement remains as it is right now.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Tremosa i Balcells Ramon
s.text: We have to open our borders and reach an agreement with the European agriculture sectors, not in their back.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Tremosa i Balcells Ramon
s.text: The European Commission carried out some studies that showed clearly that the Euro-Mediterranean countries will be the most negatively affected by the EU-Morocco Agreement.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Tremosa i Balcells Ramon
s.text: I would not ratify this agreement without the inclusion of some clauses concerning the labour market, the social dimension and the environment in Morocco.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Tremosa i Balcells Ramon
s.text: The risk of doing nothing is the loss of our farming activity and our food chain industry, specially in the Euro-Mediterranean countries.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Tremosa i Balcells Ramon
s.text: These are the concerns I wanted to share with you tonight.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Thank you ehm Mr President, next week, all across ehm the world, people will be celebrating the life of Scotland's national poet, Robert Burns.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: And as many of you know, a central part of a Burns supper is this, a haggis.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Currently, there's a ban in the USA on importing Scottish haggis, yet 1 in 3 Americans claim Scottish ehm ancestry and would like to try some authentic Scottish haggis.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: What action can the Commission and the Council take in their transatlantic dialogues to put haggis, Scottish haggis back, not just on the agenda, but also on the menu when it comes to American traditional Scottish Burns suppers?

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Stihler Catherine
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: President, in December, EU Commission President Barroso told me by letter that his meeting with President Nazarbayev last October would help advance respect for human rights in Kazakhstan.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: The same was said about granting Kazakhstan the chairship of the OSCE in 2010 and a major OSCE summit in Astana in December.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: However, world leaders has scarcely left that summit when it was announced that a referendum would be held in March to cancel the presidential election in 2012, thus keeping Nazarbayev in power until 2020 .

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: Harassment is being stepped up of the opposition press and of human rights defenders.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: Activists from the left-wing... movement 'Kazakhstan 2012' are being harassed and jailed.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: I demand that the EU stop boosting the Nazarbayev dictatorship.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: The independent trade union and social movements in Kazakhstan must be fully supported to lead mobilisations to end this dictatorship, just like the people power in Tunisia ended the Ben Ali dictatorship, and to put in place structures to bring the wealth of Kazakhstan in the democratic ownership of the majority.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Higgins Joe
s.text: Thank you President.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Papadopoulou Antigoni
s.text: Mr President, I also want to raise the issue of respect of religious freedom for all, without discrimination, because this is a basic human right.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Papadopoulou Antigoni
s.text: Yet this human right was violated in my country for the few Christian people attending the Christmas mass at the Church of Agios Synesios in the occupied village of Rizokarpaso.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Papadopoulou Antigoni
s.text: The so-called police of the Turkish occupation regime entered the church and forced the pli- let the priest to terminate the Christmas Day service and forced the Greek Cypriots enclaved attending the mass to evacuate the church.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Papadopoulou Antigoni
s.text: The European Parliament must strongly condemned such actions, which reveal the ugly and, ugly and oppressive face of the Turkish occupation in the northern part of Cyprus, in violation of the European ehm law and human rights and the Third Vienna Agreement of 1975.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Papadopoulou Antigoni
s.text: EU must stop Turkey and its subordinate local administration in the occupied part of Cyprus to violate further and continue the ethnic cleansing of the remaining 300 Christian Greek Cypriots.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: Ehm the food supplements Directive was adopted in 2002 but it, almost 9 years later, is still not fully implemented.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: The Commission has yet to produce a proposal to harmonise the maximum amounts of vitamins and minerals that can be included in food supplements as required by the Directive.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: This failure means companies have to produce multiple product formulations to comply with different national laws.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: This is unfair and expensive, especially as a scientific model for setting maximum amounts is available, that the Commission itself cited in a paper in 2006.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: It begs the question:

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: "Why hasn't the proposal ehm been produced?"

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: Perhaps, to quote Robbie Burns, whom somebody mentioned a minute ago, 'The best laid plans of mice and men and the Commission gang aft agley'.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: It needs to happen very soon, because EU legislation is intended to make life easier for companies to compete in the internal market by standardising... requirements.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: The sooner it happens, the better.

text.topicspec: One minute speeches
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: I urge the Commission to get a move on.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: Just briefly, I want to ehm ask some questions.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: Regarding the European Union, I know that ehm we are wonderful for ehm donating aid to where it's needed, but it often goes through NGOs.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: And I'd just like to know: are there any NGOs that haven't been up to scratch, that there have been complaints about in the countries they're operating or that the European Union itself might have reservations about?

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: In other words, do we just give the aid and the supplements, let's put it that way, to the NGOs annually?

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: And where is the accountability?

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: Because I saw some programmes recently and I was moderately concerned about what the programmes alleged some of the NGOs were doing and their lack of accountability.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: Having said that, I know that the vast vast majority are doing good work and are properly motivated.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm thank you Mr President, ehm I I very much welcome madam Stif- Striffler's report, as well as the Parliament's ehm involvement and continued strong advocacy for effective European humanitarian action.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm the Consensus was adopted in 2007.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: It provides a an essential common policy framework for the EU: a common vision accompanied by an action plan.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm both Member States and the Commission have responsibility, a shared responsibility to make sure that the Consensus is well implemented.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm and I want to stress that, from the report, ehm what comes very clearly is a message that humanitarian principles, international humanitarian law and protection of the humanitarian space ehm have to be at the centre of our ehm action on the Consensus.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm two-f- ehm of of our humanitarian aid, four-fifth goes for people in need in conflict-related, man-made ehm emergencies.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm and for us to be able to reach these people, it is critical that... our aid is independent and neutral and it is perceived in this way.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: And I just want to give one example.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: I just came back from Yemen where, together with the ehm UN High Commissioner for Refugees, Antonio Gutierrez, we engaged on humanitarian access issue ehm with high-level government officials and representatives of the al-Houthi rebel ehm movement.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: We obtained for a first time commitment on their part to facilitate humana- humanitarian access and respect delivery of aid to all Yemeni people in need, in line with these humanitarian principles of neutrality and independence.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm having spent ehm a number of hours with ehm with men with Kalashnikovs, ehm I want to wi- witness that that we in Europe do bring this value of neutrality that is a bridge to people in need.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm and in this case, we talk about ehm 300,000 Yemeni refugees... ind- ehm sorry ehm internally displaced people and many more hundred thousands affected by 6 wars in 6 years in the north of ehm Yemen.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm but, for long-lasting impact, humanitarian aid of course is not the instrument.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: It is development, it is development that can make ehm the ehm foundation for lasting, lasting peace.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm l- we in the Commission have finished a year-long review process of the European Consensus action plan, in close liaison with our Member States and humanitarian partners.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: And on ehm December 8, the Commission adopted a Communication on this.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm what the review shows is that over the past 3 years, we have made significant contributions to strengthen the humanitarian ehm response ehm in terms of advocacy and humanitarian action and also by bringing humanitarian aid and civil protection together.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: But we also concluded that there is scope for further improvement in 3 areas.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: First, to promote the quality and effectiveness of aid... by good assessment, well-coordinated response and investment in disaster risk reduction and local capacity.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: At a time when needs are growing and budgets are constrained, this is critical.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: And let me just ehm respond to the que- here on on the question of accountability, because, obviously, we need to stretch every euro to the fullest and deliver it in the highest possible quality, most effective ehm way.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: What we do for that, to make sure that our partners, UN agencies and N- NGOs, are accountable, is we review one-third of all partners and one-third of all projects every year.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: And we have in all hotspot... areas of the planet ehm our own humanitarian aid offices to m- to be the ears and the eyes of our taxpayers, ehm in in Yemen, because of the increasing humanitarian ehm needs.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: I just cut the ribbon of a of our humanitarian aid ehm office.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The second issue that we s- we see room for improvement is ehm to strengthen the i- the ehm the European voice.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: We are the largest donor and we have to make sure that we speak very clearly with one voice.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm and also that we reach out to other donors, that we play our leadership role, vis-à-vis traditional ehm donors, but also by by engaging new donors.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: And 3, by ensuring coherence and that means working, with the External Action Service, ehm with military actors to make to to make sure that principled... humanitarian approaches is safeguard and it promotes, ehm it is promoted in everything we, in Europe, do.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm let me just finish ehm by by ehm once again ehm thanking madam ehm Strifflers Strifflers for what what she has done on that issue ehm and call upon the Parliament to continue the discussion on on on this topic, because... the world has changed.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: There would be more and more, unfortunately, more and more... disasters caused by nature or by man.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: And how we act upon them would determine not only the lives of the people ehm impacted, but also the moral standing and the capacity of the EU to lead in the world.

text.topicspec: European Consensus on humanitarian aid
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: # you Mr President and I'd like to thank Mrs Sârbu, our rapporteur, for the excellent work she has done on this report and for her cooperation with all of the shadows.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: Ehm it follows work which I carried out in the pa- previous mandate on the role of the common agriculture policy and global food security.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: I regret that it is before midnight we debate this report and perhaps it will be at a minute to midnight that Europe and the world wakes up... to the realities of how insecure we are when it comes to food production.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: So, this report is extremely welcome in our overall debate on this issue and in the context of our debate on reform of the common agriculture policy.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: I w- had some concerns, ehm but I think they're reflected in the final ehm text.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: The idea that one form of production system is better than another, that organic, small, local, ehm I don't think is a good argument.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: I think we need all production systems to contribute to our food security.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: We do need to address market volatility and speculation and I don't think we have all the answers yet.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: The single key problem with agriculture is low incomes for farmers.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: Young farmers will not work for nothing, and we have to address the low income problem if we want security of food supply.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: McGuinness Mairead
s.text: But thank you for your report.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: Ehm madam Sârbu covered a multitude.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: I'm not going to go over all the things she mentioned, but 2 points I would like to reiterate.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: The need for a well-funded CAP.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: And I hope this Parliament will play a key role in that... to ensure that the CAP is not ehm demeaned or diminished in any way.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: Secondly, to ensure that young ehm people are encouraged to go into farming as a livelihood.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: One other point I would like to make myself and that is in regard to the fact that we have ehm a policy of encouraging energy crops being produced in good agricultural land.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: In view of the fact that we may be facing a food shortage worldwide, with increased population of 80 million per year, should we reassess that policy?

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: Are we robbing Peter to pay Paul or perhaps robbing Paul and Peter and finish up with nothing?

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Kelly Seán
s.text: That's the question I'd like to put.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Járóka Lívia
s.text: # ehm on in relation to many other issues that are going on in the Parliament, we are discussing ehm the poorest of the poor, the European Roma, and we are all facing, with the new Hungarian Presidency, the European Roma strategy.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Járóka Lívia
s.text: And agriculture is very very rarely addressed, in inter-sectoral issues when it comes to the poorest of the poor, and ehm especially because n- no lands are earned by the poorest of the poor in Europe.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Járóka Lívia
s.text: And, in this sense, ehm it's not only about the food security but having the food on the table.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Járóka Lívia
s.text: As one of my ehm other colleagues has already says, is an is an essential question of the EU today.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Járóka Lívia
s.text: So, I believe that the agricultural sector, and the Commission working out these documents, has to be in line with all the other micro-regional development projects of the EU which are trying to fight poverty and secure food on the table of the future generation.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Járóka Lívia
s.text: Thank you very much.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Thank you Mr President, the Commission very much welcomes this timely report, on ehm as food prices are rising sharply, mainly due to erratic weather conditions and natural disasters, but also to increases in energy prices that impact the cost of food.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Ehm and therefore, I want to thank the ehm rapporteur, ehm Ms ehm Sârbu, and the members of the Committee on Agriculture and Rural Development for for their ehm efforts.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Food security is fundamental for the almost 1 billion people around the world that still ehm suffer from from hunger, but it is also important for vulnerable populations across Europe.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: For them, the common agricultural policy makes a real difference.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The, sometimes criticised, ehm CAP has managed to provide EU citizens with food at affordable prices... as ensuring food security in Europe.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: This must continue.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Food security is identified as a central issue in the communication on the ehm common agriculture policy towards 2020 that was adopted ehm on November 18 by by the Commission.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The report that Ms Sârbu put in front of us underlines the issue of excessive price volatility, which is closely linked to food security... because of the impact it has both on farmers and on the consumers.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The Commission fully agrees that there is a need to tackle excessive price volatility.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: We must collectively look for better regulation, supervision and transparency to address market issues, and this resq- requires not only better financial regulations but it also requires ehm substantially to improve transparency on the market.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The ehm report recommends ehm the creation of a global food system.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Not an easy subject.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: We had experiences in the past of commodity boards.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: They have proved to not be successful... ehm and therefore, this topic undoubtedly requires more detailed deba- debate.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: It also requires analysis of the experience we have gained, for example, experience we have gained from the 1 billion Food Facility adopted by the Commission in 2008, ehm also from the work that the Commission undertakes closely with FAO and the w- World Food Programme to ensure that bumper stocks are pre-positioned in order to soften the blow of rising food prices.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: All these efforts can be developed when the G20 looks closely into the stocks... food stocks issue, and you can be assured that the ehm European Commission will be an active participant in the related ehm deliberations ehm in the coming in the coming weeks.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Finally, the report, and many of you in this room this evening, call for a strong agricultural and rural development policy in Europe, capable of ensuring food security for all, ehm with the support of research and innovation to face the challenges of producing more with the fewer resources we have and will have.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: The Commission fully agrees with this.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: There is no relev- other relevant instrument to fulfil these objectives than a strong common agricultural policy able to guarantee the economic and environmental competitiveness of agriculture and, as some of you said, able to bring young people into the agricultural sector of Europe.

text.topicspec: Agriculture as a strategic sector in the context of food security
speaker.name: Georgieva Kristalina
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement –Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the EC and Serbia (debate)
speaker.name: Gyori Eniko
s.text: Madam President, it's a great privilege for me and even an honour to be back to the European Parliament in my new capacity as representative of the Hungarian rotating Presidency of the Euro- of the Council of the European Union.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement –Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the EC and Serbia (debate)
speaker.name: Gyori Eniko
s.text: I hope ehm, honourable members, that you will consider me a former member of this House, a guarantee that the Hungarian Presidency will be a Parliament-friendly Presidency.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement –Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the EC and Serbia (debate)
speaker.name: Gyori Eniko
s.text: I look forward to working with you all during the forthcoming 5 and a half months of this Presidency, with great expectations.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement –Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the EC and Serbia (debate)
speaker.name: Gyori Eniko
s.text: Ehm let me use my mother tongue from now on.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Thank you very much madam President, ehm honourable members of the European Parliament.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: It is a great pleasure and a honour for me to address the European Parliament today for the vote of consent to the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with the Republic of Serbia.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: I would also like to express my warm gratitude to the rapporteur for Serbia, Mr Jelko Kacin, for his report on the European integration process ehm of Serbia.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: The Stabilisation and Association Agreement is a major step forward for Serbia on its path towards the European Union.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: The fundamental objective of this agreement is to pave the way for further European integration and reforms and to prepare Serbia for the European Union membership.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: This important milestone shall serve as an encouragement for Serbia, as it has renewed its efforts to promote reconciliation in the region.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: The Stabilisation and Association Agreement sets up a comprehensive institutional framework through the SAA Council and SAA Committee, a renewed framework for political dialogue, and a web of subcommittees covering extensively most European Union policy areas and, naturally, it also establishes a specific body between your Assembly and the Serbian Parliament, the Joint Parliamentary Committee.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: From an economic standpoint, the SAA foresees the gradual establishment of a free trade zone and the gradual integration of Serbia into the European Union's internal market, thus bringing economic benefits to both the European Union and Serbia.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Like in central Europe in 90s, the agreement will boost investment, in particular, for indirect investments, it will make a key contribution to the growth of the Serbian economy and help Serbia move towards a functioning market economy.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: The benefits for the European Union of this agreement are equally significant.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Serbia's market is now open up to the European Union exporters.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Previously relatively high tariffs will be totally dismantled within a couple of years, with the exception of a few very sensitive agricultural products.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Furthermore, by gradually integrating Serbia into the internal market, conditions for investors become more stable and predictable.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Rules on competition and State aid are aligned to those of the European Union.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Protection of intellectual property rights is gradi- gradually also brought up to the European Union standards.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Progressively, the sizeable Serbian public procurement market is also opened up to European bidders.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Forging closer ties with Serbia entails a number of other advantages for the European Union in particular, as it will facilitate cooperation in the areas of justice, freedom and security, environment, transport and customs, just to mention a few.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: It therefore contributes to making the European Union policy in the south-east Europe more credible and effective.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Finally, it is particularly noteworthy that Serbia anticipated on the implementation of the interim agreement, which officially entered into force in February 2010, but which Serbia decided to apply already shortly after its signature in April 2008.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Serbia has thereby demonstrated commitment to its economic integration with the European Union and has so far established a positive track record.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Since the Council decided on 14 June 2010 to launch the ratification process for the agreement, 9 Member States have notified the ratification and 2 more have secured the approval of their Parliament.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Today's vote by the European Parliament should therefore bring additional impetus to this process thanks to the unanimous support across political groups.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: I therefore hope the ratification by other Member States will follow soon.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Madam President, honourable members of the European Parliament, let me conclude my remarks by focusing on the draft resolution on the European integration process of Serbia as well-prepared contribution to today's political debate, for which I'm grateful to the rapporteur, Jelko Kacin.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: The resolution sends to Serbia both a message of support for furthering of the European Union-Serbia relations and one of expectation regarding the key challenges on Serbia's path to the European Union membership.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: This is particularly timely in the context of the preparations of the opinion on Serbia's membership application.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: I was in Belgrade last November to hand over a detailed questionnaire to the Prime Minister and the Deputy Prime Minister for European integration.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: The Serbian authorities are currently working hard on their replies, which we expect by the end of the month.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: I'm encouraged by the adoption by the Serbian Government on the 30 December of an action plan as follow-up of the Commission's progress report.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: The European Commission will thoroughly analyse the replies to the questionnaires and measures undertaken by the Serbian authorities in the coming months to complete its assessment with a view to issuing the opinion in the second half of 2011.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Madam President, honourable members of the European Parliament, as my Hungarian colleague said, 2011 is an important year for Serbia: a year of demanding challenges as well as a year of opportunities.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: The path has been set and the objectives are well known, yet it is up to Serbia to walk down this path, fulfil the required criteria and, once ready, engage into the negotiation process with the European Union.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: I'm convinced that, with our joint support, Serbia will continue to make the right European choices and move ahead in its integration efforts.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: This will deliver a positive message for the whole region at a time when we need to reaffirm its European perspective in order to consolidate peace and foster economic prosperity in the Western bar- Balkans.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Thank you very much.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: Thank you President, Minister, Commissioner, ehm the report on Serbia in my view is excellent.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: My congratulations to the rapporteur, Jelko Kacin.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: Serbia, it seems to me, has finally made up its mind that it genuinely wants a European future for itself.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: The majority of the political elite believes that this is the most favourable option.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: Now, this determination has to be seen in the light of the turbulence of the last 2 decades.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: Serbia experienced the end of communism, the collapse of Yugoslavia, the wars that ensued, the rule of Slobodan Milosevic, the bombing of 1999, burgeoning mafias and criminality, violence, refugees: a depressing and traumatic history.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: The decision to opt for Europe, therefore, is a considerable achievement and signals that Serbia has become a factor of stability in the region. 2 major political problems remain: the arrest and transfer of Ratko Mladic to The Hague and coming to terms with the independence of Kosovo.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: Both these point towards psychological barriers.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: Mladic has his protectors and the loss of Kosovo is painful for a sizeable sect- section of Serbian society;

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: ehm any loss of territory is painful.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: To these may be added ehm several other areas that need attention, notably, the upgrading of public administration, of the administration of justice, of establishing market conditions and full openness towards Serbia's past, opening the archives included.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: The auguries for Serbia's road towards Europe are reasonably good.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: There is a clear commitment in this direction.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: The tasks faced by the elite and by society are recognised and the technical preparations are going ahead.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: If all goes well, Serbia should receive the avis this autumn and candidate status after that.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Schöpflin György
s.text: The road to Europe will not be easy, but Europe as a whole benefits from a stable, democratic Serbia.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: # progress towards EU membership is gathering pace, and rightly so, as evidenced by the excellent Kacin report.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: When I was in Serbia last October, I was impressed with the commitment and effort of Serbia's dynamic, western-orientated democratic government.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: Serbia has much work still to be done, relating to judicial reform and the fight against organised crime.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: We in the ECR also hope that Ratko Mladic will be caught and sent to The Hague, though it's by no means certain he's on Serbian territory.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: But it's vital that Serbia's progress is reciprocated and rewarded by the EU and its Member States, such as the need now to ratify the SAA, not least because some of Serbia's neighbours, such as Croatia, are far more advanced on the road to EU accession.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: Serbia's relationship with Kosovo is problematic but not insoluble.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: I personally believe that an equitable full and final settlement based on partition and the 'land for peace' principles we see in the Middle East would be the best way forward.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: In my view, the EU should properly evaluate this option during the forthcoming dialogue brokered by the High Representative.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: To dismiss it out of hand would be dangerously short-sighted and would only perpetuate Kosovo's state of limbo in terms of international recognition at EU, NATO and UN level.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Tannock Charles
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Severin Adrian
s.text: # you Mrs Chair, ladies and gentlemen, Stabilisation and Association Agreement and the European integration of Serbia are important for both Serbia and the European Union.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Severin Adrian
s.text: I should like to make 2 remarks.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Severin Adrian
s.text: To negotiate properly the agreement and to manage properly the integration process, the European Union should start by identifying and recognising its own interests.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Severin Adrian
s.text: Europe has an unsolved Albanian problem, a lack of geopolitical coh- coherence in its southern flank, a black hole of organised crime and corruption in its Balkan area, which means in the middle of the Union, a need for an enlarged functional and cohesive market and for better transportation corridors in that area.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Severin Adrian
s.text: None could be solved without the contribution of Serbia.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Severin Adrian
s.text: My second remark: we have to avoid in treating Serbia as a second-hand European country and to lecture it on every occasion.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Severin Adrian
s.text: Indeed, Serbia committed a lot of sins, but when we come to sins the European U- the Euro-Atlantic contribution is also impressive. 2011 is a year of challenging opportunities indeed but for both Serbia and the European Union.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Severin Adrian
s.text: We could not raise at the level of these opportunities if we do not leave aside any narcissism and treat Serbia as a peer.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Severin Adrian
s.text: Only a dignified Serbia could be a reliable partner for a historic reconciliation in the Balkans and a historic unification within the European Union.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Severin Adrian
s.text: To this extent, I think that the report of Mr Kacin make a ehm remarkable contribution.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Severin Adrian
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Ludford Sarah
s.text: Thank you madam President, ehm I join those who have ehm praised and welcomed the report of my colleague ehm, Jelko Kacin, and I thoroughly ehm agree ehm that ehm in his remarks Serbia's future lies in the European Union and Serbia will become an important player in guaranteeing security and stability in the region of the Western Balkans.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Ludford Sarah
s.text: I have supported the aim of the Western Balkans ehm... becoming members of the EU for the last decade, including when I was the Vice-Chair of the Balkans ehm Delegation.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Ludford Sarah
s.text: I was one who worked closely with our rapporteur ehm in championing visa-free travel and I was delighted ehm when that was secured for Serbia, among others, a year ago.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Ludford Sarah
s.text: I think that is a really vital contribution to ehm person-to-person contacts and raising horizons and, ultimately, guaranteeing ehm security in its wider sense.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Ludford Sarah
s.text: But, some of the challenges that are faced by Serbia have been mentioned.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Ludford Sarah
s.text: Ehm I would ehm als- like to add that a judicial reform where the Commission's ehm report, progress report last autumn ehm sounded a note of of concern about reimpo- reappointment procedures being carried out in a non-transparent way, putting at risk the principle of independence of the judiciary and ehm creating a high risk of political influence.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Ludford Sarah
s.text: That clearly is a key issue for the Rule of Law.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Ludford Sarah
s.text: Ehm then, for ehm the cooperation with the Hague Tribunal, Mr Jellik last night told the Foreign Affairs Committee that Serbia is doing absolutely everything in its power to locate, apprehend and transfer the remaining 2 indictees to The Hague, but Mr Brammertz, the Chief Prosecutor, in his speech to the Security Council in September, said Serbia must bridge the gap between its stated commitment to the arrests and the effectiveness of its operations on the ground.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Ludford Sarah
s.text: We are not seeing results.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Ludford Sarah
s.text: Serbia needs to adopt a more proactive approach to arresting the fugitives, so I'm afraid that there is a gap between rhetoric and reality, and that absolutely must be bridged.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Kukan Eduard
s.text: Thank you, I am glad to see that Serbia has shown strong determination and made substantial progress in the integration process.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Kukan Eduard
s.text: Concluding the SAA and its implementation is the next important step on this road.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Kukan Eduard
s.text: Serbian Government should be commended for the actions which were taken to this stage.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Kukan Eduard
s.text: I'm sure that SAA will bring concrete economic and trade benefits for the country in many areas like environment, energy, transport and many others. 13 countries have so far ratified this agreement.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Kukan Eduard
s.text: I hope that the ratification by the European Parliament will encourage the rest to conclude the process soon.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Kukan Eduard
s.text: Yet, there are still challenges ahead for both Serbia and the EU.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Kukan Eduard
s.text: Serbia needs to commit to full cooperation with the ICTY bringing remaining war criminals to justice.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Kukan Eduard
s.text: There is also an urgent need for progress in the fight against corruption and organised crime, further reforms in the sectors of justice and public administration.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Kukan Eduard
s.text: Equally, Serbian Parliament needs to abandon practices of blank mandates and arbitrary allocations of seats in the Parliament.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Kukan Eduard
s.text: Finally, the dialogue between Serbia and Kosovo, hopefully, will be put on the right track and guarantee ordinary people better prospective for the... future.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Kukan Eduard
s.text: Finally, the European Parliament has always s- been strong supporter of the integration of the Western Balkans.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Kukan Eduard
s.text: Serbia is a crucial part of that with this commitment...

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Bostinaru Victor
s.text: Thank you very much ehm Mrs President, ehm Mr Commissioner, the Stabilisation and Association Agreement with Serbia represents another important step in the process of integration towards the EU urd- undertaken by Serbia.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Bostinaru Victor
s.text: We are talking about a country whose progress in the recent years has already been impressive and I think that a further political and economic integration on the basis of the SAA will give the final boost to Serbia-EU path.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Bostinaru Victor
s.text: But considering the important role that Ser- Serbia plays in the Western Balkans, the SAA will have a positive influence not only on the EU and Serbia as such, but also on the whole region by facilitating its security, stability and development, as well as posing solid foundation for the enlargement process in the Western Balkans.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Bostinaru Victor
s.text: I hope that, after the green light of the European Parliament, the SAA agreement process can be concluded as soon as possible.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Bostinaru Victor
s.text: I would therefore ask the Member States to ensure that the ratification process can run in the smoothest and rapid manner.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Bostinaru Victor
s.text: Thank you very much.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Madam President, honourable members ehm of the European Parliament, let me thank for this rich debate which has shown the constructive support of your House to the European Union integration process of Serbia.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: The support provided ehm by the Parliament to the ratification process of the SAA is an important signal for Serbia and shall contribute to intensify ehm its efforts on the path towards the European Union.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Let me also address ehm shortly ehm some questions ehm which were addressed ehm during that debate to honourable member Belder first ehm, on Sandak, ehm I would rather talk about the politicisation ehm of the issue of Muslim representation rather ehm than of the surge of radical Islamism.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Ehm in that context, we are looking forward to the repeated election ehm of the Bosniak National Council in ehm later this year, ehm in in April, which will be peaceful and inclusive ehm and it will help foster dialogue and avoid radical- radicalisation.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: The question on Development Fund, ehm we are in a close dialogue with Serbia and ehm other countries in the Western Balkan region how to make the best use of ehm IPA and how to make it even more effective.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Ehm reflection is going on regarding ehm the support to technological development.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Ehm concerning the question ehm of honourable member Morvai, ehm let me say that we pay of course in particular the attention to human rights and also attention to the protection ehm of the minority rights.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Ehm and I will ehm pursue a letter ehm to you address one concrete case you referred ehm to in your intervention.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Ehm madam President, honourable members, ehm I am personally very encouraged by Serbia s- serious and constructive approach ehm to the current stage of enlargement process.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: Where we have talked yesterday about concerns, we are talking today about Serbia being on the right track and that concern, for example, such an important issue as the judicial reform.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: And this is a good basis for Serbia to fully use integration potential year 2011 offers.

text.topicspec: EC Serbia Stabilisation and Association Agreement
speaker.name: Füle Stefan
s.text: I thank you very much.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Morvai Krisztina
s.text: Thank you very much ehm, may I ask you sir how do you dare criticising the Hungarian Presidency when it is just starting?

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Morvai Krisztina
s.text: You don't even know anything about it.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Morvai Krisztina
s.text: Why don't you instead criticise your comrades in the Socialist Group who were shooting at their own people on the 50th anniversary of the 1956 revolution and who put arbitrarily hundreds of people into prison?

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Morvai Krisztina
s.text: Ehm ask them and criticise them.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Morvai Krisztina
s.text: Thank you.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: # make laws together but too often we don't know how those laws get applied by Member States.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: And you have taken the lead in making clear that this Parliament supports the Commission.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: It wants to see correlation tables included within all future legislation.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: The Belgian Presidency has been very helpful in tabling a paper to the Council in which it promotes the use of correlation tables, emphasizing that they help clarity and transparency and will make the application of the EU EU law more quick and effective.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: You've had a you've set up a, I think, period of discussion or a period of reflection.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Davies Chris
s.text: Now, I wonder, in your concluding remarks, Prime Minister, if you could just tell us what sort of response you've had to that paper and whether the Belgian government will continue to press for the inclusion of correlation tables as, in its role, as part of the troika and within the Council.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: Thank you President, Mr Prime Minister, please, Mr Prime Minister, I I would like to have your attention please.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: I'm here, on your left.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: Mr Prime Minister, please, I need to have a a frank conversation with you and I'm going, I had a text in Portuguese but I'm going to improvise in English because that was the language you used in the, what for me was the most important part of your speech when you said 'Look at refugees.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: Look at the refugees.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: If you think that war and peace is not important for Europe'.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: For you were addressing the new generations.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: And I have to admit that my my heart jumped when you said that because I am the European Parliament rapporteur for refugees.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: And during your Presidency you could have done more than look at refugees.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: You could have done something to help and it was not difficult.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: The Council could have finished the codecision procedure that Parliament started on resettlement of refugees.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: In our part of the codecision, we have increased the money that we give to Member States to resettle refugees, we have established categories of priorities for people who have been raped, who have been tortured, who have diseases and are waiting in camps to be resettled and Council has not completed the codecision.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: So, it seems that it was because of Article 290 and delegated acts - something that is in the Treaty of Lisbon.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: So you say 'Look at refugees'.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: But I challenge you to do what we did: go to al-Hol camp in Syria and tell refugees:

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: 'Look at Article 290, look at delegated acts'.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: They will tell you:

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: 'What are you talking about?

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: My kids are not going to school, I don't have a passport, we are stuck in a refugee camp.

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: Why are you talking about the minor institutional problem when you could have done something to help our problem?' .

text.topicspec: Review of the Belgian Presidency of the Council
speaker.name: Tavares Rui
s.text: And this will soil the Belgian Presidency, I am sorry to say you # I say this in sadness.
